Note that MISRA-C:2004 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C:2004 programming model or by explicitly enabling the 191 entry configuration flag in the c/cppvals.dat file (TBmisra license permitting).

Example
typedef unsigned short Uint_16;
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
/**********************************************************
 * Standard 330 S : Implicit conversion of underlying type.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
Uint_16 u16a = 0U;
Uint_32 u32a = 0U;
 
void static_330(void)
{
  u16a = u32a;  /* implicit conversion to a narrower type */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 192   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-AC : 10.1, 10.2   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.1, 10.2   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.3, R.10.4   Modifiers : 191 = 1
NETRINO : 5.3.c, 5.4.b   Modifiers : 191 = 1
SEC-C : R2.5.1   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy
331 S
Literal value requires a U suffix.

A U suffix shall be applied to all constants of unsigned type.

This standard can be relaxed to allow zero literal values without a U by setting the modifier 358 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

The standard can be further restricted to check for the use of signed literal values in array declarations by setting the modifier 309 to 1.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************
 * Standard 331 S : Literal value requires a U suffix.
 *****************************************************/ 
 
void static_331(void)
{
  UINT_32 x1 = 5;   /* not compliant */
  UINT_32 y1 = 6U;
  UINT_64 z1 = 0;  /* not compliant, but permitted by modifier 358 */
 
  y1 = y1 * 7;     /* not compliant */
                   /* Integer constant '7' should be '7U' when forming part
                       of an expression containing unsigned int types. */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : INT13-C  
CWE : 195   Modifiers : 358 = 1
DERA : 18  
EADS-C++ : 23  
HIC++ : 6.1  
HIS : 18  
MISRA-AC : 10.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-4  
MISRA-C:1998 : 18  
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.7.2, R.10.3, R.10.4  
SEC-C : M1.2.2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML , VSOS
332 S
Widening cast on complex integer expression.

An explicit cast to a wider underlying type shall not be performed on the value of a complex integer expression. Conversions on complex expressions are often a source of confusion.

Note that this standard is only enabled by setting the modifier 191 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
typedef unsigned short Uint_16;
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
/***************************************************************
 * Standard 332 S : Widening cast on complex integer expression.
 ***************************************************************/ 
 
Uint_16 u16a = 40000U;
Uint_16 u16b = 30000U;
 
void static_332( void )
{
  Uint_32 u32 = (Uint_32) (u16a + u16b);
  /*...*/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : INT02-C   Modifiers : 191 = 1
CWE : 192   Modifiers : 191 = 1
LMTCP : 365  
MISRA-AC : 10.3   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-8  
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.3   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.8   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
333 S
Widening cast on complex float expression.

An explicit cast to a wider float type shall not be performed on the value of a complex float expression. Conversions on complex expressions are often a source of confusion.

Note that this standard is only enabled by setting the modifier 191 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
typedef float Float_32;
typedef double Float_64;
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 333 S : Widening cast on complex float expression.
 *************************************************************/ 
 
void static_333(void)
{
  Float_32 f32a = 4.0F;
  Float_32 f32b = 3.0F;
  Float_64 f64 = (Float_64) (f32a + f32b);
  /*...*/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 10.4   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-8  
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.4   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.8   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
334 S
No cast when ~ or << applied to small types.

The result of applying the bit-wise operator ~ or << to an operand of underlying type unsigned char or unsigned short shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand. The effect of any unanticipated behaviour due to high order bits introduced through integral promotion is then avoided.

Note that MISRA-C:2004 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C:2004 programming model or by explicitly enabling the 191 entry configuration flag in the c/cppvals.dat file (TBmisra license permitting).

Example
typedef unsigned short Uint_16;
typedef unsigned char Uint_8;
 
/***************************************************************
 * Standard 334 S : No cast when ~ or << applied to small types.
 ***************************************************************/ 
 
Uint_8 port = 0x5aU;
 
Uint_16 mode = 0xffff;
Uint_16 result_16;
Uint_16 another_result_16;
 
void static_334 (void)
{
  result_16 = ((port << 4) & mode) >> 6;      /* not compliant - no cast !*/ 
  another_result_16 = ((Uint_16)((Uint_16)port << 4) & mode) >> 6;  /* correct casting, albeit widening... */ 
  /*...*/
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : INT02-C   Modifiers : 191 = 1
LMTCP : 298  
MISRA-AC : 10.5   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-10  
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.5   Modifiers : 191 = 1
SEC-C : R2.5.3   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
335 S
Operator defined contains illegal items.

The operator defined shall not process any expression other than a macro identifier, which has either previously been defined or has not been previously defined.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
const UINT_32 max_value = 255U;
 
/***********************************************************
 * Standard 335 S : Operator defined contains illegal items.
 ***********************************************************/ 
 
#if defined(X > Y)  /* undefined behaviour, not compliant */ 
  /* ... */ 
#endif
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
HIS : 100  
LMTCP : 42  
MISRA-AC : 19.14  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-1-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 100  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.14  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
SEC-C : M4.7.4  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , UML
336 S
#if expansion contains define operator.

The defined operator shall not be included in a #if pre-processor directive through macro expansion substitution.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
const Uint_32 max_value = 255U;
 
/**********************************************************
 * Standard 336 S : #if expansion contains define operator.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
#define DEFINED defined
 
#if DEFINED(X)           /* undefined behaviour, not permitted */ 
  /* ... */ 
#endif
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
HIS : 100  
LMTCP : 42, 411  
MISRA-AC : 19.14  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-1-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 100  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.14  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
SEC-C : M4.7.4  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , UML
337 S
Undefined macro variable in #if.

Macro identifiers specified in #if pre-processor directive shall be defined before use.

Example
/***************************************************
 * Standard 337 S : Undefined macro variable in #if.
 ***************************************************/ 
 
#if DEBUG1
  /* do something */ 
#else
  /* do something else */ 
#endif
 
void foo(void)
{
  /*...*/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIS : 97  
LMTCP : 48  
MISRA-AC : 19.11  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-0-7  
MISRA-C:1998 : 97  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.11  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.20.9  
SEC-C : M4.7.3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
338 S
#include preceded by non preproc directives.

A #include statement shall only be preceded by other pre-processor directives or comments.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***************************************************************
 * Standard 338 S : #include preceded by non preproc directives.
 ***************************************************************/ 
 
void static_338(void)
{
  ; /*...*/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C : 2.4.4  
LMTCP : 39  
MISRA-AC : 19.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-0-1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.20.1  
NETRINO : 4.3.b  
339 S
#include directive with illegal items.

A comment shall not appear between the pre-processor directive #include and the associated header filename.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"           /* compliant */ 
 
#include /* not compliant */ "bar.h"
 
/**********************************************************
 * Standard 339 S : #include directive with illegal items.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
void static_339(void)
{
  ; /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
MISRA-AC : 19.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-2-5, 16-2-6  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.3  
SEC-C : P1.4.1  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , UML
340 S
Use of function like macro.

The #define pre-processor directive shall not be used to create inline macros. Inline functions shall be used instead.

Example
typedef signed int Sint_32;
 
/**********************************************
 * Standard 340 S : Use of function like macro.
 **********************************************/ 
 
#define COMMON_MACRO(X, Y) ((X) * (Y))
 
const Sint_32 s1 = 42;
const Sint_32 s2 = 7;
 
Sint_32 foo(void)
{
  Sint_32 myInt = COMMON_MACRO(s1, s2);
  return myInt;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : PRE00-C  
CWE : 735  
EADS-C++ : 48  
FSB582-C++ : 1.4  
HIC++ : 14.15  
HIS : 93  
JSF++ AV : 29  
LMTCP : 35  
MISRA-AC : 19.7  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-0-4, 16-2-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 93  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.7  
MISRA-C:2012 : D.4.9  
NETRINO : 6.3.a  
SEC-C : E1.1.1, M5.1.3  
Related standards filter models
UML
341 S
Preprocessor construct as macro parameter.

Pre-processor constructs shall not be used as arguments to a function-like macro. Macro expansion substitution may lead to unpredictable behaviour.

Example
#define S1
typedef signed int Sint_32;
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 341 S : Preprocessor construct as macro parameter.
 *************************************************************/ 
 
#define COMMON_MACRO(X) (X)
 
Sint_32 foo(void)
{
  Sint_32 my_int = COMMON_MACRO(
#ifdef S1
  1
#else
  2
#endif
  );
 
  return my_int;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
HIS : 95  
JPL : 8  
LMTCP : 47  
MISRA-AC : 19.9  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-0-5  
MISRA-C:1998 : 95  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.9  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.20.6  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , UML
342 S
Extra chars after preprocessor directive.

Ensure that pre-processor directives are not followed by any character other than white-space. All pre-processor directives shall be syntactically valid even when they occur within an excluded block of code.

Example
#define DIAGS
 
typedef enum Flag
{
  on,
  off
} Flag;
 
/************************************************************
 * Standard 342 S : Extra chars after preprocessor directive.
 ************************************************************/ 
 
#ifdef DIAGS
  Flag x1 = on;
#else1           /* not compliant */ 
  Flag x1 = off;
#endif
 
void static_342 (void)
{
  ; /* ... */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 19.16  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-0-8  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.16  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.20.13  
SEC-C : M1.12.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
343 S
#else has no #if, etc in the same file.

A series of pre-processor directives that control the inclusion and exclusion of blocks of statements shall reside in the same file.

This standard is not available if "SHORTEN" is set to TRUE, which is the default value.

Example

Static_343.c

#define DEBUG1 1
 
 /**********************************************************
 * Standard 343 S : #else has no #if, etc in the same file.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
#if DEBUG1  == 1
 
#include "Static_343.h"
 
 
 /*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */

Static_343.h

 /**********************************************************
 * Standard 343 S : #else has no #if, etc in the same file.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
  /* do nothing */ 
 
#else
 
  /* do something */ 
 
#endif
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JPL : 8  
LMTCP : 43  
MISRA-AC : 19.17  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 16-1-2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 19.17  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.20.14  
SEC-C : M4.7.2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
344 S
Cast on volatile value.

Avoid casting away volatile qualification as this may cause the compiler to perform optimisations that are not valid, leading to unexpected results in optimised builds.

This standard can be restricted to check only pointer types by setting the modifier 395 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/******************************************
 * Standard 344 S : Cast on volatile value.
 ******************************************/ 
 
volatile UINT_32 *y1;
 
static void static_344 ( void )
{
   UINT_32 *y2 = (UINT_32 *)y1;  /* not compliant - cast to ... a pointer to non-volatile int */ 
}   
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP32-C  
CWE : 704  
FSB582-C++ : 1.11  
HIC++ : 7.3  
LMTCP : 328, 334  
MISRA-AC : 11.5   Modifiers : 395 = 1
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-2-5   Modifiers : 395 = 1
MISRA-C:2004 : 11.5   Modifiers : 395 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.11.8   Modifiers : 395 = 1
SEC-C : R2.7.2   Modifiers : 395 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
345 S
Bit operator with floating point operand.

The use of floating-point values as operands to the bit operators is a constraint error in C, but not all compilers detect this problem. No floating-point manipulations should be made which rely on the way the values are stored. The storage of floating-point numbers is compiler-dependent.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/************************************************************
 * Standard 345 S : Bit operator with floating point operand.
 ************************************************************/ 
 
void static_345(FLOAT_32 fl1)
{
  UINT_8 bitmap = ~fl1; /* not compliant */
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 10.11, 13.6  
HIS : 16  
LMTCP : 262  
MISRA-AC : 12.12  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 3-9-3  
MISRA-C:1998 : 16  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.12  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.1, R.10.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME , UML
346 S
Bit field is not unsigned integral or enum type.

Bit-fields shall have explicitly unsigned integral or enumeration types only. An explicit unsigned declaration prevents unexpected sign extension or overflow.

Note that this standard is only enabled with the JSF++ AV programming model or by setting the modifier 234 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef enum Range
{
  first,
  second,
  third
} Range;
 
/***********************************************************
* Standard 346 S : Bit field is not unsigned integral or enum type.
************************************************************/ 
 
typedef struct Message
{
  UINT_32 ui_set:0x4;
  UCHAR   uc_set:0x1;
  SINT_32 si_set:0x4;    /* not compliant */ 
  FLOAT_32 y_set:0x8;    /* not compliant */ 
  Range    z_set:0x2;
} Message;
 
void static_346(void)
{
  Message message_chunk;
  /* ... */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 *  Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 154   Modifiers : 234 = 1
Related standards filter models
UML
347 S
Macro parameter list has leading space.

No spaces shall be inserted between a function-like macro identifier and its parenthesised parameter list.

Example
typedef signed int Sint_32;
 
/**********************************************************
 * Standard 347 S : Macro parameter list has leading space.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
#define PENALTY_MACRO (XIN, YIN) ((XIN) * (YIN))
#define GOOD_MACRO(XIN, YIN) ((XIN) + (YIN))
 
const Sint_32 s1 = 42;
const Sint_32 s2 = 7;
 
Sint_32 foo(void)
{
  Sint_32 myInt = GOOD_MACRO( s1, s2);
  return myInt;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 29  
LMTCP : 35  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
348 S
Use of the NULL macro.

A pointer shall not be compared to NULL or be assigned to NULL. Plain 0 should be used rather than NULL, which is an implementation-defined C++ null pointer constant.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
#include <stdio.h>
 
/************************************************
 * Standard 348 S : Use of the NULL macro.
 ************************************************/
 
static void static_348( void )
{
  UCHAR * uc = NULL;        /* not compliant */
  if( uc == 0 ) {  ; }      /* compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 50  
HIC++ : 14.16  
JSF++ AV : 175  
LMTCP : 318  
349 S
Enumeration is not all lower case.

Identifiers for enumerator values shall be lower case. Using lower case avoids the possibility of accidental macro substitution.

Example
typedef enum Seasons
{
  SPRING,    /* not compliant */
  summer,
  autumn,
  winter
} Seasons;
 
/*****************************************************
 * Standard 349 S : Enumeration is not all lower case.
 *****************************************************/ 
 
static void static_349(Seasons season)
{
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 52  
350 S
Const variable is not all lower case.

Identifiers for constant values shall be lowercase. Using lowercase avoids the possibility of accidental macro substitution.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
const Uint_32 DEFINT = 1U;
 
/********************************************************
 * Standard 350 S : Const variable is not all lower case.
 ********************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  Uint_32 my_int = DEFINT;
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 52  
351 S
Type declaration with variable definition.

A variable will not be declared in the definition of its type. Otherwise the type will be unnamed, and unable to be referenced and reused. Furthermore the resulting code will be difficult to read.

Example
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 351 S : Type declaration with variable definition.
 *************************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  enum
  {
    up,
    down
  } direction;
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 141  
Related standards filter models
UML
352 S
Declaration of type not in header file.

Object and function types shall not be defined in an implementation file. Every implementation file shall include the header files that uniquely define the types used.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef enum Seasons  /* not compliant */
{
  spring,
  summer,
  autumn,
  winter
} Seasons;
 
/**********************************************************
 * Standard 352 S : Declaration of type not in header file.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
void Seasons static_352 (INT_32 month)
{
  Seasons ss;
  /* ... */ 
  return ss;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL12-C  
HIC++ : 8.1.1  
JSF++ AV : 40  
LMTCP : 61  
Related standards filter models
UML
353 S
Inline member has more than *** statements.

Only declare trivial functions 'inline'. Limit inline member functions to the pre-determined maximum number of statements - typically 1 or 2. The compiler is not compelled to make a function inline. The request to inline the function could be ignored, and the decision criteria differs from one compiler to another.

Inline functions do not necessarily improve performance and they can have a negative effect. Inappropriate use will lead to longer compilation times, slower runtime performance and larger binaries.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
const Uint_32 agelimit = 18U;
const Uint_32 junior = 0;
 
//
// Standard 353 S : Inline member has more than *** statements.
// 
 
class Person
{
  public:
    Person();
    explicit Person(const Uint_32 personNum);
    explicit Person(const Person &person);
    Person & operator=(const Person &person);
    ~Person();
  protected:
  private:
    Uint_32 personal_number;
  public:
    void adjust_num(void)
    {
      personal_number++;
      if (personal_number < agelimit)
        personal_number = junior;
      personal_number++;
    }
};
 
 
void foo(void)
{
  Person p1(10);
  p1.adjust_num();
  //... 
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 5  
HIC++ : 11.8  
JSF++ AV : 121   Modifiers : 290 = 1
LMTCP : 222   Modifiers : 290 = 1
Related standards filter models
Standard , UML
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

354 S
Extern declaration is not in header file.

External objects shall not be declared in more than one file. External objects should be declared in header files which will then be included in all those files that use those objects (including the files which define them).

Example

Static_354.h

#ifndef STATIC_354_H
#define STATIC_354_H
 
#include "c_standards.h"
 
extern UINT_32 day;    /* compliant - defined in static_354.c */
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 354 S : Extern declaration is not in header file.
 *************************************************************/
 
#endif
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */

Static_354.c

#include "Static_354.h"
 
UINT_32 day = 1U;
 
extern UINT_32 season;  /* not compliant - should be in header file */
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 354 S : Extern declaration is not in header file.
 *************************************************************/
 
static void static_354 (void)
{
  /* ... */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 7, 8  
HIC++ : 8.1.1  
JSF++ AV : 139  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 3-3-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
355 S
Variables not unique within *** characters.

User-specified identifiers will not rely on the significance of more than a pre-determined maximum number of characters - typically 64, although the some standards suggests a minimum of 1024 characters will be significant.

The length is user definable. The *** symbols refer to a user definable number for this standard, defaulting to 64. The configuration is made in the c/cpppen.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 355 S : Variables not unique within *** characters.
 *************************************************************/
 
static void static_355(void)
{
  UINT_32 s12345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012_a;
  UINT_32 s12345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012_b;
  /* ... */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL32-C  
CWE : 736  
EADS-C : 38  
JSF++ AV : 46  
LMTCP : 69  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , Standard , UML
356 S
Pointer to pointer declared.

Pointers to pointers should be avoided when possible. An alternative form of abstraction should be used instead; preferably one providing memory management and error handling facilities.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***********************************************
 * Standard 356 S : Pointer to pointer declared.
 ***********************************************/ 
 
void static_356(void)
{
  UINT_32* uptr[10];  /* compliant - array of pointers is ok */
 
  UINT_32 **upp;     /* not compliant - pointer to pointer */
 
  upp = uptr;               
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JPL : 9  
JSF++ AV : 169  
LMTCP : 313  
Related standards filter models
UML
357 S
Base class is mixed virtual and non virtual.

A base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy, as the hierarchy becomes difficult to comprehend and use.

Example
/**************************************************************
 * Standard 357 S : Base class is mixed virtual and non virtual.
 ***************************************************************/ 
 
class A
{
  public:
  protected:
  private:
};
 
class D1 : public A
{
  public:
  protected:
  private:
};
 
class D2 : public virtual A
{
  public:
  protected:
  private:
};
 
class D3 : public D1, public D2 /* not compliant */
{
  public:
    void foo()
    {
      ;
    }
 
 
  protected:
  private:
};
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 89  
LMTCP : 135  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 10-1-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

358 S
Class member name reused.

Class member identifiers shall not use the same name as an identifier used elsewhere, such as a member function local variable or parameter. Name reuse leads to confusion, and ambiguous or incorrect code.

A duplicate violation of 91 S can be suppressed by setting the modifier 246 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***********************************************
* Standard 358 S : Class member name reused.
************************************************/ 
 
class S_358
{
  public:
    void foo(UINT_32 &some_int);  /* not compliant */
 
  private:
    UINT_32 some_int;
};
 
 
/*
 *
 *  Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 30  
HIC++ : 8.2.1  
JSF++ AV : 135   Modifiers : 246 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , Standard , UML
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

359 S
Default parameter use.

In C++ ambiguities may arize if an overloaded function exists with default arguments. Default arguments are not part of the standard C language, but may be available with some compilers. This standard highlights all uses of default parameters.

By default, this standard is only available for C++ files, but it may be enabled for C files by setting the modifier 401 to 1 in the creport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************
 * Standard 359 S : Default parameter use.
 *******************************************/
 
class Base
{
  public:
    Base();
    explicit Base(const Base &bs);
    Base & operator=(const Base &bs);
    ~Base();
 
    void foo(UINT_32 par );
 
    void foo(UINT_32 par, UINT_32 par2 = 0U); /* not compliant */
  protected:
  private:
};
 
 
void static_359(void)
{
  Base base_obj;
  base_obj.foo(3U);  /* which foo function is called? */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 42  
HIC++ : 12.1  
360 S
Incompatible type.

An object or function type declared more than once shall be compatible.

Example
#include "c_standards.h";
 
extern incompatible_int;
 
/*****************************************
 * Standard 360 S : Incompatible type.
 *****************************************/ 
 
UCHAR incompatible_int = '0'; /* not compliant */
 
void static_360 (void)
{
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 8.4  
MISRA-C:2004 : 8.4  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
361 S
Expression needs brackets.

The operator precedence rules are complicated and it is easy to make a mistake. The use of parenthesis helps avoid such errors and helps to make the code easier to read.

By default this standard is strict and requires parenthesis for all operands that have a precedence greater than that of the operator. An exception is made for simple expressions such as identifiers, function calls and the unary operators & * + - ~ !.

Guidelines differ in where parenthesis should be used and so this standard can be configured as follows:

Modifier Default Behaviour when set to 1
420 0 ++ and -- operators do not require parentheses
264 0 + - * / % are treated as having the same level of precedence
119 0 or 1 different operators with the same level of precedence require parenthesis
421 0 different operators with the same level of precedence do not require parenthesis
414 0 require parenthesis around the operand of sizeof

This standard can be configured by setting the modifiers to 0 or 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file. Note: Modifier 119 is set to 1 if you have a MISRA license and should not be altered. When modifier 421 is set to 0, the behaviour is dependent on the value of modifier 119, but when set to 1 overrules it.

Parenthesis checking on the logical operators is covered by 49 S.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*********************************************
 * Standard 361 S : Expression needs brackets.
 *********************************************/ 
 
SINT_32 static_361(SINT_32 x1,
                   SINT_32 x2,
                   SINT_32 x3)
{
  SINT_32 z1;
  z1 = z1 * x2  >> 3U;   /* not compliant */  
  z1 = x1 * x2 + x3;     /* not compliant, but permitted by modifier 264 */
  z1 = x1 * x2++;        /* not compliant, but permitted by modifier 420 */
  z1 = x1 + x2 - x3;     /* not compliant, when modifier 119 set to 1 and 421 set to 0 */
  z1 = x1 + x2 + x3;     /* compliant */
  return z1;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP00-C   Modifiers : 264 = 1, 421 = 1
CWE : 783   Modifiers : 264 = 1, 421 = 1
DERA : 47  
EADS-C : 98  
FSB582-C++ : 9.15  
GJB : 5.1.2  
HIC++ : 10.4   Modifiers : 264 = 1
HIS : 47  
JSF++ AV : 213   Modifiers : 264 = 1
LMTCP : 363, 398   Modifiers : 264 = 1
MISRA-AC : 12.1   Modifiers : 420 = 1
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-2   Modifiers : 420 = 1
MISRA-C:1998 : 47  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.1   Modifiers : 420 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.12.1, R.20.7   Modifiers : 414 = 1, 420 = 1, 421 = 1
NETRINO : 1.4.a  
SEC-C : M1.4.2   Modifiers : 264 = 1, 421 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
362 S
main program in a namespace.

The main() function shall be the exception to the rule that states every non-local name be placed in a namespace. The main() function is the designated start of the program, and there is only ever one occurrence permitted.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***********************************************
 * Standard 362 S : main program in a namespace.
 ***********************************************/
 
namespace MySpace
{
  const UINT_32 ok = 0U;
 
  void static_362(UINT_32 &my_param)
  {
    // ...
  }
 
  int main(void) /* not compliant */
  {
    UINT_32 my_var = ok;
    // ...
    static_362(my_var);
    // ...
    return ok;
  }
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 98  
LMTCP : 156  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-3-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

364 S
Inherited default parameter redefined.

A function's inherited default parameter shall never be redefined. The redefinition of default parameters for virtual functions often produces surprising results due to the fact that virtual functions are dynamically bound and default parameter values are statically bound.

This standard can be further restricted to check to redefinitions using the same value by setting the modifier 385 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************
* Standard 364 S : Inherited default parameter redefined.
*********************************************************/
 
class Base
{
  public:
    Base();
    explicit Base(const Base &bs);
    Base& operator=(const Base &bs);
    ~Base();
    virtual void foo(UINT_32 my_int = 0);
  protected:
  private:
};
 
class Derived : public Base
{
  public:
    Derived();
    explicit Derived(const Derived &dv);
    Derived& operator=(const Derived &dv);
    ~Derived();
    virtual void foo(UINT_32 my_int = 1);  /* not compliant */
  protected:
  private:
};
 
void static_364(Derived &obj)
{
  Base &base_obj = obj;
  // ... 
  base_obj.foo();  // calls Derived::foo with my_int = 0 !!! 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 3.3.12  
JSF++ AV : 95  
LMTCP : 146  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 8-3-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

365 S
Hexadecimal number with upper case char.

Hexadecimal numbers shall be written using lower case letters.

This standard can be relaxed so as to allow an upper case X by setting the modifier 208 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
/****************************************************************
 * Standard 365 S : Hexadecimal number with upper case char.
 ****************************************************************/ 
 
typedef enum mask_enum_type
{
  mask_first = 0x01,	 /* ok */ 
  mask_all = 0xFF       /* not compliant */ 
} mask_enum_type;
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 90  
366 S
String continuation - use of \.

It shall not be permitted to use the backslash character to continue a string. String continuation is unwieldy and may cause problems with some compilation tools. A long string may need to be broken down into two or more strings.

Example
#include <stdio.h> 
 
/*************************************************
 * Standard 366 S : String continuation - use of \.
 *************************************************/ 
 
void static_366 (void)
{
  printf("This is quite a long text string that\
spans several lines\n");   /* not compliant */
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 141  
SEC-C : M1.2.3  
367 S
Macro continuation - use of \.

It shall not be permitted to use the backslash character to continue a macro definition. Macro continuation is unwieldy and may cause problems with some compilation tools. A long macro may need to be broken down into two or more macros, or represented as a function.

Example
/*************************************************
 * Standard 367 S : Macro continuation - use of \.
 *************************************************/ 
 
#define S1(X) (\
(X) + ((X) * 2))
 
void static_367 ( void )
{
  ;
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 141  
368 S
Pragma continuation - use of \.

It shall not be permitted to use the backslash character to continue a pragma definition. Pragma continuation is unwieldy and may cause problems with some compilation tools. A long pragma statement may need to be broken down into two or more statements.

Example
/*************************************************
 * Standard 368 S : Pragma continuation - use of \.
 *************************************************/ 
 
#pragma This is just an example using \
        to continue a pragma.
 
#pragma Another example "using" \
        but with a string before it!
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 141  
369 S
Name found with length greater than ***.

Names should be no more than a pre-determined maximum length - typically 60 characters. Names should be meaningful but also readily comprehend-able.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
/**********************************************************
* Standard 369 S : Name found with length greater than ***.
* A/Ref:
***********************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  Uint_32 my_over_sixty_characters_long_non_compliant_integer_type_instance;
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 39  
NETRINO : 6.1.d, 7.1.d  
370 S
If nest depth greater than ***.

An if statement should not be nested greater than a pre-determined maximum number of levels deep - typically 4. Deeply nested code is difficult to debug and maintain.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
const UINT_32 top_value = 255U;
 
/**************************************************
 * Standard 370 S : If nest depth greater than ***.
 **************************************************/ 
 
void static_370(UINT_32 a1, UINT_32 a2, UINT_32 a3)
{
  if (a1 > a3)
  {
    if (a1 > a2)
    {
      if (a2 > a3)
      {
        if (a2 < top_value)
        {
          if (a1 > top_value)  /* not compliant - exceeds nested limit of 4 */ 
          {
            /* ... */ 
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 121  
FSB582-C : 3.7.11  
FSB582-C++ : 9.4  
NETRINO : 8.2.b  
371 S
No space after comma in parameter list.

Space characters shall be used following commas in an actual parameter list to help separate the arguments.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
const UINT_32 x1 = 5U;
const UINT_32 x2 = 3U;
 
/**********************************************************
 * Standard 371 S : No space after comma in parameter list.
 **********************************************************/ 
 
void call(UINT_32 a1, UINT_32 a2)
{
  if (a1 > a2)
  {
    /* ... */ 
  }
}
 
 
void static_371 (void)
{
  call(x1,x2);  /* not compliant - no space */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 150  
FSB582-C++ : 10.12  
NETRINO : 3.1.k  
372 S
* or & not attached to name in declaration.

If '*' or '&' is used in a declaration, then no space should occur between the '*' or '&' and the name.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/**************************************************************
 * Standard 372 S : * or & not attached to name in declaration.
 **************************************************************/
 
void static_372(INT_32* my_int_ptr)  /* not compliant */
{
  ; /* ... */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 158  
FSB582-C : 3.3.9  
FSB582-C++ : 10.13  
373 S
Use of integer division.

The implementation of signed integer division ( / and % ) in the chosen compiler should be determined, documented and taken into account. C99 and Java both specify that division will always round towards zero, but it is undefined in C90.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************
 * Standard 373 S : Use of integer division.
 *******************************************/
 
static void static_373(void)
{
  const INT_32 x1 = -5;
  const INT_32 x2 = 3;
  INT_32 b1 = x1 / x2;  /* not compliant -  Could be -1 remainder -2, or -2 remainder +1 */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIS : 41  
LMTCP : 301  
MISRA-AC : 3.3  
MISRA-C:1998 : 41  
MISRA-C:2004 : 3.3  
Related standards filter models
UML
374 S
Name conflict with typedef.

A typedef name shall be a unique identifier, and not reused either as a typedef or for any other purpose.

Note that MISRA-C:2004 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C:2004 programming model or by explicitly enabling the 191 entry configuration flag in the c/cppvals.dat file (TBmisra license permitting).

Example
typedef unsigned int unique_type;
 
/**********************************************
 * Standard 374 S : Name conflict with typedef.
 **********************************************/ 
 
void static_374( void )
{
  unique_type unique_type;  /* not compliant */
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
LMTCP : 89  
MISRA-AC : 5.3   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2004 : 5.3   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.5.6   Modifiers : 191 = 1
SEC-C : M1.7.1   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Related standards filter models
UML
376 S
Use of octal escape sequence.

The use of octal escape sequences should be avoided. The inadvertent introduction of a decimal digit ends the octal escape and introduces another character subject to implementation definition.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/************************************************
 * Standard 376 S : Use of octal escape sequence.
 ************************************************/ 
 
void static_376(void)
{
  CHAR octal_escape,
       n_octal_escape;
 
  n_octal_escape = '\01';    /* Not Compliant */ 
  n_octal_escape = '\109';   /* Not Compliant */ 
  octal_escape = '\0';       /* Compliant - exception to rule */ 
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC10-C  
CWE : 176  
LMTCP : 270  
MISRA-AC : 7.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 2-13-2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 7.1  
SEC-C : M1.8.5  
Related standards filter models
UML
377 S
Null character used within a string.

The use of the octal escape sequence '\0' within a string to indicate a null character should be avoided. The inadvertent introduction of a decimal digit ends the octal escape and introduces another character subject to implementation definition. Furthermore the null character serves to terminate the string when it may not be desirable to do so.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************
 * Standard 377 S : Null character used within a string.
 *******************************************************/ 
 
void static_377(void)
{
  CHAR * n_octal_point = "abc\017";   /* Not Compliant */ 
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 170, 464  
MISRA-AC : 7.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 7.1  
SEC-C : M1.8.5  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
378 S
Tag and type mismatch in struct/union/enum.

The data type name and tag name used to identify a structure, union or enumeration shall be identical. Using different names can create unnecessary confusion.

Example
/**************************************************************
 * Standard 378 S : Tag and type mismatch in struct/union/enum.
 **************************************************************/ 
 
typedef enum my_enum
{
  first,
  second,
  third
} seq_enum;   /* not compliant */
 
void static_378 ( seq_enum pos )
{
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 86  
379 S
Macro exceeds *** continuation lines.

The lines of code substituted for a macro should not exceed the pre-determined maximum number - typically 4.

Example
typedef signed int Sint_32;
 
const Sint_32 m1 = 4;
const Sint_32 m2 = 3;
 
/********************************************************
 * Standard 379 S : Macro exceeds *** continuation lines.
 * A/Ref:
 ********************************************************/ 
 
#define MIN(a, b) ((a) \
                   < \
                   (b) \
                   ? (a) \
                   : (b) \
                   )
 
void foo(void)
{
  Sint_32 res = MIN(m1, m2);
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 91  
380 S
Enumeration element not on a new line.

Each member of an enumerated type shall be declared on a separate line to aid readability.

Example
/*********************************************************
 * Standard 380 S : Enumeration element not on a new line.
 * A/Ref:
 *********************************************************/ 
 
typedef enum my_enum
{
  first,
  second, third
} my_enum;
 
void foo(void)
{
  enum my_enum pos;
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 157  
381 S
Enum, struct or union not typedeffed.

The typedef facility shall be used to create new user defined types as required, and shall specifically be used to define all enumerated types, structures and unions.

Example
/********************************************************
 * Standard 381 S : Enum, struct or union not typedeffed.
 * A/Ref: 6.1.7.15 & 6.3.7.9
 ********************************************************/ 
 
enum my_enum
{
  first,
  second,
  third
};
 
void foo(void)
{
  enum my_enum pos;
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL05-C  
CWE : 736  
EADS-C : 85  
NETRINO : 5.1.b  
382 S
(void) missing for discarded return value.

A function call in which the returned value is discarded shall be clearly indicated using (void).

This standard can be further restricted to check for discarded returns from library functions by setting the modifier 383 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
UINT_32 my_const = 42U;
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 382 S : (void) missing for discarded return value.
 *************************************************************/ 
 
UINT_32 a_fn(UINT_32 us1)
{
  return us1;
}
 
void static_382(void)
{
  a_fn(my_const);   /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP12-C, FIO04-C, FIO33-C   Modifiers : 383 = 1
CWE : 252, 273, 737   Modifiers : 383 = 1
EADS-C : 116  
JPL : 7  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 0-1-7  
MISRA-C:2004 : 16.10   Modifiers : 383 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.17.7   Modifiers : 383 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy
383 S
Identifier name matches macro name.

An identifier shall not use the same name as a macro, regardless of scope. Hiding identifiers with an identifier of the same name in a nested scope leads to code which is very confusing.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
#define X2(X) ((X) + (X))
 
/******************************************************
 * Standard 383 S : Identifier name matches macro name.
 * A/Ref:
 ******************************************************/ 
 
Uint_32 X2;  /* Violation - 2nd use of name */ 
 
Uint_32 foo(Uint_32 us1)
{
  /* ... */ 
  return us1;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 5.6, 5.7  
MISRA-C:2004 : 5.6, 5.7  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.5.5  
SEC-C : M1.7.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
384 S
Identifier matches macro name in 31 chars.

User-specified identifiers will not rely on the significance of more than 31 characters, as required by the ISO standard.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
#define ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ1234_M(X) ((X) + (X))
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 384 S : Identifier matches macro name in 31 chars.
 *************************************************************/ 
 
UINT_32 ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ1234_V;  /* not compliant - matches macro name (up to 31 chars) */ 
 
static UINT_32 static_384(UINT_32 us1)
{
  return us1;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 5.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 5.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.5.4, R.5.5  
Related standards filter models
UML
385 S
MISRA switch statement syntax violation.

A switch statement shall only contain switch labels and switch clauses, and no other code.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef enum FavouriteSeasons
{
  spring,
  summer,
  autumn,
  winter
} FavouriteSeasons;
 
FavouriteSeasons season;
UINT_32 x1;
 
/***********************************************************
 * Standard 385 S : MISRA switch statement syntax violation.
 ***********************************************************/ 
 
void static_385(void)
{
  switch (season)
  {
    UINT_32 decl_b4_1st_case;   /* Not Compliant */ 
 
    case spring:
      x1 = 1U;
      break;
 
    case summer:
      x1 = 4U;
      break;
 
    case autumn:
      x1 = 7U;
      break;
 
    case winter:
      x1 = 10U;
      break;
 
    default:
      /* No default action required */ 
      break;
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C : 3.9.2.1  
MISRA-AC : 15.0  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-4-3  
MISRA-C:2004 : 15.0  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.16.1  
Related standards filter models
UML
386 S
Less than *** blank lines separating procs.

Blank lines shall be used to separate logical groupings of source code lines, and specifically there should be a pre-determined minimum number of lines between procedures.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
/**************************************************************
 * Standard 386 S : Less than *** blank lines separating procs.
 * A/Ref:
 **************************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  /* ... */ 
}
                    /* insufficient space */ 
void bar(Uint_32 p1)
{
  foo();
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 147  
FSB582-C++ : 10.9  
387 S
Enum initialisation not integer literal.

An enumeration constant is a list of integer constant values, and shall only be associated with integer literals.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
Uint_32 s4 = 4U;
 
typedef enum FavouriteSeasons
{
  spring = 1,
  summer = 2,
  autumn = 3,
  winter = s4         /* Not compliant */ 
} FavouriteSeasons;
 
FavouriteSeasons season;
Uint_32 x1;
 
/***********************************************************
 * Standard 387 S : Enum initialisation not integer literal.
 * A/Ref:
 ***********************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  switch (season)
  {
    case spring:
      x1 = 1U;
      break;
 
    case summer:
      x1 = 4U;
      break;
 
    case autumn:
      x1 = 7U;
      break;
 
    case winter:
      x1 = 10U;
      break;
 
    default:
      /* No default action required */ 
      break;
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.2  
CERT-C : DCL08-C  
CMSE : 13.1.5  
GJB : 5.1.4  
388 S
Extern used in function body.

An extern variable may be accessed by any function in a program file, and as such shall be declared at file scope.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
const Uint_32 limit = 99U;
 
/************************************************
 * Standard 388 S : Extern used in function body.
 * A/Ref:
 ************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  extern Uint_32 x1;  /* Not compliant */ 
 
  if (limit == x1)
  {
    /* ...*/ 
  }
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CMSE : 1.1.26  
GJB : 5.1.21  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
389 S
Bool value incremented/decremented.

The increment ++ and decrement -- operators shall not be used on a boolean type variable. Specific functions should be used to assign or change booleans rather than arithmetic operations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef enum Bool
{
  false,
  true
} Bool;
 
const UINT_32 limit = 99U;
 
/******************************************************
 * Standard 389 S : Bool value incremented/decremented.
 ******************************************************/ 
 
void static_389(UINT_32 x1)
{
  Bool b1 = false;
 
  if (limit == x1)
  {
     b1++;	  /* Not Compliant */ 
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 136  
EADS-C++ : 39  
HIC++ : 10.16  
LMTCP : 305  
MISRA-AC : 12.6  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.6  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
390 S
Typedef array declaration.

Array types shall not be used as the basis of a typedef declaration. Problems can arise relating to bounds checking and incorrectly specified deletion syntax.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/************************************************
 * Standard 390 S : Typedef array declaration.
 ************************************************/
 
typedef CHAR arraytype[20];    /* not compliant */
 
static void static_390(void )
{
  ;
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 32  
HIC++ : 8.4.8  
LMTCP : 266  
391 S
Public constructor in abstract class.

An abstract class shall have no public constructors. Abstract classes cannot be used to declare objects; by making constructors protected it is explicit that the class can only be used from derived classes.

Example
/***********************************************************
 * Standard 391 S : Public constructor in abstract class.
 ***********************************************************/ 
 
class AbstractBase
{
  public:
    AbstractBase();               /* Not Compliant  */
  protected:
    AbstractBase & operator=(const AbstractBase &ab);
    explicit AbstractBase(const AbstractBase &ab);
    virtual ~AbstractBase();
    virtual void fn_391(void)=0; /* pure virtual function */
  private:
};
 
 
void fn_391(void)
{
  ; /* ... */ 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 12  
HIC++ : 3.2.4  
LMTCP : 151  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

392 S
Class data accessible thru non const member.

A const member function shall not return non-const pointers or references to member data. Non-const handles indirectly allow modification of class data.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***************************************************************
 * Standard 392 S : Class data accessible thru non const member.
 ***************************************************************/
 
class Person
{
  public:
    Person();
    Person & operator=(const Person &ab);
    explicit Person(const Person &ab);
    virtual ~Person();
    UINT_32 &get_number(void) const
    {
      return num;  // not compliant - permits subsequent modification of private data
    }
 
  protected:
  private:
    UINT_32 num;
};
 
static void static_392(void)
{
  const Person person;
  UINT_32 &rn = person.get_number();
  rn = 10;          // modifies private data in person! 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 19  
HIC++ : 3.4.2, 3.4.3  
LMTCP : 154, 155  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 9-3-1, 9-3-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

393 S
Single parameter constructor not 'explicit'.

All single argument constructors shall be declared as explicit thus preventing their use as implicit type convertors.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***************************************************************
 * Standard 393 S : Single parameter constructor not 'explicit'.
 ***************************************************************/
 
class Person
{
  public:
    Person();
    explicit Person(const UINT_32 personNum);
    Person(FLOAT_32 sal);                      /* not compliant */
    explicit Person(const Person &person);
    Person & operator=(const Person &person);
    ~Person();
  protected:
  private:
    UINT_32 personalNumber;
    FLOAT_32 salary;
};
 
void use(Person const & );
 
static void static_393(void)
{
  use( Person( 10 ) );  // ok, explicit  - but if it were 'use( 10 )' it would not compile
  use( 20.0 );          // implicit conversion
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
/
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 7  
HIC++ : 3.1.10, 3.2.3  
LMTCP : 112, 321  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 12-1-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

394 S
Conversion function found.

Conversion operators should not be used, as implicit conversion operators can take place without the programmer's knowledge.

Example
/*********************************************
 * Standard 394 S : Conversion function found.
 *********************************************/
 
class CExampleC;
 
class CExampleD
{
  public:
    explicit CExampleD( CExampleC ); // 1
};
 
class CExampleC
{
  public:
    operator CExampleD();            // 2  - not compliant
};
 
void use( CExampleD );
 
static void static_394(void)
{
  CExampleC c;
  use( c );    // Ambiguous (convert to CExampleD by 1 or 2?)
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 8  
HIC++ : 3.1.10, 3.1.11  
LMTCP : 321  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

395 S
Public base use of STL library member.

STL containers shall not be used as public base classes. They lack a virtual destructor, which may cause problems when deleting derived objects (also see 303 S).

Testbed must first be configured to list the STL members that are to be checked. The names must be added to the STLTRE list in the cpptbend.dat file, prefixed by the number of letters in the name. Normally this list is empty apart for a fictitious example called example_name_zz.

C list of standard template library class names. RDSTL, STLTRE
   15 example_name_zz
Example
#include <list>
 
/*********************************************************
 * Standard 395 S : Public base use of STL library member.
 * assumes "std::list" has been added to STLTRE list.
 *********************************************************/
 
template <typename T>
class MyList : public std::list<T> /* not compliant */
{
  // ...
};
 
static void static_395(void)
{
  MyList<INT_32> *pHeapLis = new MyList<INT_32>;  // allocate derived obj on heap
  std::list<INT_32> *pBaseLis = pHeapLis;         // access through base class
  delete pBaseLis;                                // undefined behaviour!
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 58  
HIC++ : 17.7  
LMTCP : 176  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

396 S
Possible ambiguous numeric/pointer overloads.

Overloading on both numeric and pointer types shall not be performed, as it is not obvious which function is called when there is a numeric argument.

Example
typedef char Char;
 
//
// Standard 396 S : Possible ambiguous numeric/pointer overloads.
// A/Ref:
// 
 
class One
{
  public:
    void foo(Char cc);
    void foo(class Y * yy);
};
 
 
void fn(void)
{
  One my_one;
  my_one.foo( 0 );   // ambiguous 
  my_one.foo( 1 );   // calls foo( Char ) 
  my_one.foo( '1' ); // calls foo( Char ) 
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
EADS-C++ : 41  
HIC++ : 11.9  
LMTCP : 218  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

397 S
Array initialisation has insufficient items.

An array shall be fully populated upon initialisation. If there are fewer initialising data objects than the subscript limit, all excess elements in the array are set to zero. This may not be what the user expected.

This standard can be relaxed to allow the initialisation of character arrays with string literals shorter than the array size by setting the modifier 415 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the c/cppreport.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/**************************************************************
* Standard 397 S : Array initialisation has insufficient items.
***************************************************************/ 
 
void static_397 (void)
{
  INT_32 my_array[3] = { 1, 2 };  /* Not Compliant */
 
  CHAR char_10[10] = "Hello";     /* Not Compliant, unless modifier 415 set to 1 */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.14  
CERT-C : ARR02-C   Modifiers : 415 = 1
CMSE : 13.1.6  
CWE : 740  
GJB : 5.1.20  
MISRA-AC : 9.2  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 8-5-2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 9.2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.9.3   Modifiers : 415 = 1
SEC-C : M2.1.1, R1.2.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
398 S
Boolean negation outside bracketed exprsn.

The use of a boolean operator to negate the result of an expression with a binary boolean operator shall be avoided. An alternative method of performing the intended logic should be used.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*************************************************************
* Standard 398 S : Boolean negation outside bracketed exprsn.
**************************************************************/ 
 
void static_398(void)
{
  UINT_32 lowertest1,
          test;
 
  /* ... */ 
 
  if (!(lowertest1 <= test)) /* not complaint */
  {
     ;
  }
 
  if (lowertest1 > test)  /* preferred */ 
  {
     ;
  }
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CMSE : 14.1.4, 14.2.1  
GJB : 4.14.2.1  
399 S
Function declared more than once.

A function should not have more than one non-defining declaration.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/***************************************************
* Standard 399 S : Function declared more than once.
****************************************************/ 
 
void static_399(SINT_32 p1);
void static_399(SINT_32 p1);    /* not compliant */ 
void static_399(UINT_32 p1);    /* not compliant - constraint error */ 
UINT_32 static_399(SINT_32 p1); /* not compliant - constraint error */ 
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.7  
CMSE : 1.1.27  
GJB : 5.1.23  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c++.

400 S
Use of sizeof on a type.

The sizeof operator shall not be applied to a type.

For example, the use of sizeof on a type may produce unexpected results depending on the padding used with a structure.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
struct My_struct
{
  UINT_16 x1;
  UINT_16 x2;
};
 
/******************************************
* Standard 400 S : Use of sizeof on a type.
*******************************************/ 
 
UINT_32 static_400( void )
{
  /* The structure may be held in 1 or 2 32-bit integers, depending on the padding */
  return sizeof(struct My_struct);  /* Not Compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
GJB : 5.1.8  
401 S
Use of sizeof on an array parameter.

Arrays passed by value are in actual fact passed as a copy of the array address. It is therefore not advisable to use the sizeof operator on an array parameter as the pointer size is likely to be returned rather than the required array size.

Furthermore, sizes of data objects stored within the array will be machine-dependent and no assumptions should be made about them when writing portable code.

Example
typedef char Char;
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
/*******************************************************
 * Standard 401 S : Use of sizeof on an array parameter.
 * A/Ref:
 *******************************************************/ 
 
void foo(Char str[])
{
  Uint_32 sz = sizeof(str);  /* "str" is an array type parameter */ 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR00-C, ARR01-C  
CMSE : 6.1.22  
CWE : 119, 129, 467  
GJB : 5.1.9  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
402 S
Comparison of booleans.

Comparison between booleans should not be made, as this may lead to results that do not match the developer's expectations.

This is particularly true in the C90 language where there is no Boolean type and by convention integer zero is regarded as false and non-zero is true. Hence a comparison between boolean types which depend upon specific values may give unexpected results.

Example
typedef enum Bool
{
  false,
  true
} Bool;
 
/******************************************
 * Standard 402 S : Comparison of booleans.
 ******************************************/
 
void static_402(Bool b1)
{
  Bool b2 = true;
 
  if (b1 == b2)  /* not compliant */
  {
    /* ... */
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CMSE : 14.1.6  
GJB : 5.1.13  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
403 S
Negative (or potentially negative) shift.

Right hand side operands used with shift operators shall not be negative. A negative shift leads to undefined behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/************************************************************
 * Standard 403 S : Negative (or potentially negative) shift.
 ************************************************************/ 
 
static void static_403( INT_32 si )
{
  UINT_32 my_var = 2U;
  const INT_32 s1 = -2;
 
  my_var = my_var << -1;  /* -1 is a negative number */ 
  my_var = my_var >> s1;  /* the value of "s1" variable is negative */ 
  my_var = my_var >> si;  /* the value of "si" variable may be negative */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.4  
CERT-C : INT34-C  
CMSE : 6.1.20  
CWE : 190, 680, 681  
DERA : 38  
GJB : 5.1.7  
HIC++ : 10.12  
HIS : 38  
JSF++ AV : 164  
LMTCP : 294  
MISRA-AC : 12.7  
MISRA-C:1998 : 38  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.7  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.1, R.12.2  
SEC-C : R2.5.4  
Related standards filter models
Customer Sample , Legacy , Standard , VSOS
404 S
Array initialisation has too many items.

The number of initialising data objects shall not be more than implied by the subscript limit. In general this is a constraint error and may overwrite an adjacent data area. However, not all compilers detect this problem.

In addition, when an array of characters is initialised with a string, the C language allows the trailing \0 to omitted. This may confuse the user and is highlighted by this standard.

This standard can be relaxed to allow the omission of the trailing \0 by setting the modifier 399 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the c/cppreport.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/**********************************************************
* Standard 404 S : Array initialisation has too many items.
***********************************************************/ 
 
static void static_404(void)
{
  INT_32 my_array[3] = { 1, 2, 3, 4 };  /* Not Compliant - constraint error */
 
  char char3[3] = "abcd";    /* Not Compliant - constraint error */
  char char4[4] = "abcd";    /* Not Compliant - omits \0, permitted with modifier 399 */
  char char5[5] = "abcd";    /* compliant  - includes \0 */
  /* ... */
 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.1  
CERT-C : ARR02-C, STR36-C  
CMSE : 6.1.19  
CWE : 665  
FSB582-C : 3.1.1   Modifiers : 399 = 1
FSB582-C++ : 1.1   Modifiers : 399 = 1
GJB : 5.1.3  
MISRA-AC : 9.2  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 1-0-1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 9.2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.1   Modifiers : 399 = 1
SEC-C : R1.2.1  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
405 S
Macro name appears in own replacement list.

The use of a macro name in its own replacement list is not expanded. This may lead to user confusion if recursion was expected.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*************************************************************
* Standard 405 S : Macro name appears in own replacement list.
**************************************************************/
 
#define MY_MACRO(X) ((X) * (MY_MACRO((X) + 1)))
                            /* not compliant */
 
void static_405 ( void )
{
    INT_32 v = MY_MACRO(3);
       /* Expands to ((3) * (MY_MACRO((3) + 1))) */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards filter models
Legacy
406 S
Use of ++ or -- on RHS of && or || operator.

The right-hand side operand of a logical expression shall not contain side-effects if, dependent upon the nature of the left-hand side, its evaluation is conditional. Any reliance on the side-effect made by subsequent statements introduces the potential for unexpected behaviour in the software.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
typedef enum Bool
{
  false,
  true
} Bool;
 
const Uint_32 max_num = 10;
 
/***************************************************************
 * Standard 406 S : Use of ++ or -- on RHS of && or || operator.
 * A/Ref:
 ***************************************************************/ 
 
void foo(Bool is_high,
         Uint_32 p1)
{
  if (is_high && (max_num == p1++))  /* increment will not take place if is_high 'false' */ 
  {
    /* ... */ 
  }
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP02-C  
CWE : 664, 682, 737, 768  
DERA : 33  
FSB582-C++ : 9.21  
HIC++ : 10.9  
HIS : 33  
JSF++ AV : 157  
LMTCP : 286  
MISRA-AC : 12.4  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-14-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 33  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.4  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.13.5  
SEC-C : M1.8.1  
Related standards filter models
Customer Sample , RUNTIME , Standard , UML , VSOS
407 S
free used on string.

Strings do not have memory explicitly dynamically allocated, and hence have no requirement for the use of the free function for de-allocation. The use of free on a string is invalid and leads to undefined behaviour.

Example
/***************************************
 * Standard 407 S : free used on string.
 ***************************************/ 
 
void static_407(void)
{
  char *str = "abcde";
 
  free(str); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MEM34-C  
CMSE : 6.1.26  
CWE : 590, 758, 762  
GJB : 5.1.19  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.22.2  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
408 S
Volatile variable accessed on RHS of && or ||.

The right-hand side operand of a logical expression shall not contain access to a volatile variable if, dependent upon the nature of the left-hand side, its evaluation is conditional. Any reliance on a value change to the volatile variable made by subsequent statements introduces the potential for unexpected behaviour in the software.

Example
typedef unsigned int Uint_32;
 
typedef enum Bool
{
  false,
  true
} Bool;
 
const Uint_32 max_num = 10;
 
/*****************************************************************
 * Standard 408 S : Volatile variable accessed on RHS of && or ||.
 * A/Ref:
 *****************************************************************/ 
 
void foo(Bool is_high,
         Uint_32 p1)
{
  volatile Uint_32 v1;
 
  /* ... */ 
 
  if (is_high && (max_num == v1))  /* v1 will not be accessed if is_high 'false' */
  {
    /* ... */ 
  }
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP02-C  
CWE : 664, 682, 737, 768  
DERA : 33  
FSB582-C++ : 9.21  
HIC++ : 10.9  
HIS : 33  
JSF++ AV : 157  
LMTCP : 286  
MISRA-AC : 12.4  
MISRA-C:1998 : 33  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.4  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.13.5  
SEC-C : M1.8.1  
Related standards filter models
Customer Sample , RUNTIME , Standard , UML , VSOS
409 S
More than one break or goto statement in loop.

For any iteration there shall be at most one break statement used to exit the loop. More than one break is not necessary if the code is well-structured.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
#include <stdio.h>
 
const INT_32 max_num = 10;
 
/****************************************************************
 * Standard 409 S : More than one break or goto statement in loop.
 ****************************************************************/ 
 
void static_409( char arr[] )
{
  INT_32 sub;
 
  for (sub = 0; sub < max_num; sub++)
  {
    if (arr[sub] == '\0')
    {
      break;
    }
 
    (void) printf("%c", arr[sub]);
 
    if (arr[sub] == 'z')
    {
      break;  /* not compliant */
    }
  } 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 14.6  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-6-4  
MISRA-C:2004 : 14.6  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.15.4  
SEC-C : M3.1.1  
Related standards filter models
UML
410 S
Switch empty default has no comment.

A switch statement shall contain a default clause which will take appropriate action in the event that prior case clauses have not been met, or at least a comment to indicate that the programmer has considered the possibility. The comment must be placed after the default and before the break.

Note that MISRA-C:2004 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C:2004 programming model or by explicitly enabling the 191 entry configuration flag in the c/cppvals.dat file (TBmisra license permitting).

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef enum FavouriteSeasons
{
  spring,
  summer,
  autumn,
  winter
} FavouriteSeasons;
 
FavouriteSeasons season;
UINT_32 x1;
 
/*******************************************************
 * Standard 410 S : Switch empty default has no comment.
 *******************************************************/ 
 
void static_410( void )
{
  switch (season)
  {
    case spring:
      x1 = 1U;
      break;
    case summer:
      x1 = 4U;
      break;
    case autumn:
      x1 = 7U;
      break;
    case winter:
      x1 = 10U;
      break;
    default:
      break;
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C:2004 : 15.3   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.16.4   Modifiers : 191 = 1
SEC-C : R3.5.2   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Related standards filter models
UML
411 S
Inappropriate value assigned to enum.

Assigning a non-enumerative value to an enumerated type shall be avoided as the result is unspecified if the value is not within the range of the enumeration.

Example
typedef enum Seasons
{
  spring = 1,
  summer,
  autumn,
  winter
} Seasons;
 
void foo(void);
 
/********************************************************
 * Standard 411 S : Inappropriate value assigned to enum.
 * A/Ref:
 ********************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void)
{
  Seasons season = autumn;
 
  /* ... */ 
 
  season++;    /* not compliant */ 
 
  /* ... */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 192  
DERA : 66, 67  
EADS-C++ : 57  
GJB : 5.1.22  
HIC++ : 15.4  
LMTCP : 336  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-2-1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , UML
412 S
Undefined behaviour, \ before E-O-F.

Ensure that all non-empty source files end with a complete language statement followed by a new-line character, otherwise the behaviour is undefined.

Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
HIC++ : 14.8  
LMTCP : 16, 62  
MISRA-AC : 1.2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 1.2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , UML
413 S
User type declared but not used in code analysed.

A type declared in the code shall be used in the declaration of an object or function. Redundant types reduce the maintainability of code.

This standard can be further restricted to check for unused declarations in included files by setting the modifier 284 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
enum Seasons /* not compliant */
{
  spring,
  summer,
  autumn,
  winter
};  
 
typedef INT_32 mytype;  /* not compliant as mytype not used in a declaration */
 
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 413 S : User type declared but not used in code analysed.
 ********************************************************************/ 
 
INT_32 static_413(void)
{
  return (mytype) 3;  
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.19  
GJB : 5.21  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 0-1-5  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.2.3, R.2.4  
NETRINO : 4.3.e  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
415 S
Single dimension array param size specified.

An array type formal parameter shall not be specified with the array size. An array intended to be passed by value is in fact always passed by reference, i.e. a copy of the address of the first entry in the array. Specifying the array size serves no purpose but to add confusion, and may conflict with the actual array size.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
#include <stdio.h>
 
const INT_32 max_num = 10;
 
/***************************************************************
