No cast for widening float parameter.

Implicit conversions shall be avoided for function arguments. A widening conversion on a float parameter must be made explicit by the use of a cast. The use of a cast makes clear the intention to convert from one type to another type.

Note that this standard is only enabled by setting the modifier 191 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 490 S : No cast for widening float parameter
 *******************************************************************/
 
extern void helper64( FLOAT_64 h1 );
extern void helper32( FLOAT_32 h2 );
 
void static_490( void )
{
    FLOAT_32 s1;
    helper32(s1);            /* compliant */
 
    helper64((FLOAT_64)s1);  /* compliant - use of a cast */
    helper64(s1);            /* not compliant - implicit widening conversion */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 10.2   Modifiers : 191 = 1
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.2   Modifiers : 191 = 1
NETRINO : 5.4.b   Modifiers : 191 = 1
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c++.

491 S
No cast for widening int parameter.

Implicit conversions shall be avoided for function arguments. A widening conversion on an integer parameter must be made explicit by the use of a cast. The use of a cast makes clear the intention to convert from one type to another type.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 491 S : No cast for widening int parameter
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
extern void helper32( UINT_32 h1 );
extern void helper16( UINT_16 h2 );
 
void static_491( void )
{
    UINT_16 s1;
    helper16(s1);          /* compliant */ 
 
    helper32((UINT_32)s1); /* compliant - use of a cast */ 
    helper32(s1);          /* not compliant - implicit widening conversion */ 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : INT02-C  
CWE : 192  
MISRA-AC : 10.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.1  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c++.

492 S
Parameter not declared on new line.

Each parameter, after the first, should be positioned on a new line by itself (with the closing parenthesis directly after the last argument). Declaring and defining functions in this way aids readability. This LDRA penalty is not applicable to code substituted into the source through macro expansion, as these checks are based on the original code and do not extend to macro definitions.

This standard can be relaxed to allow the parameters of a function with only two parameters to appear on the same line by setting the modifier 220 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 492 S : Parameter not declared on a newline
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void static_492( UINT_32 p1,                        
                 UINT_32 p2, UINT_32 p3,      /* not compliant */ 
                 UINT_32 p4 )                     
{
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
EADS-C : 83  
FSB582-C : 3.6.1, 3.7.1  
JPL : 4  
JSF++ AV : 58   Modifiers : 220 = 1
LMTCP : 83  
493 S
Numeric overflow.

Run-time operations on numeric variables that result in a value outside of the range of its type shall be avoided. The behaviour is undefined for signed integer arithmetic. In the case of unsigned arithmetic, wrap-around will occur. This may be intended in some situations, but in general the practice is regarded as unsafe.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************
 * Standard 493 S : Numeric overflow.
 *****************************************/ 
 
static void static_493( void )
{
  SINT_8 my_schar = 127;   /* 8-bit signed char types are in the range -128 to 127. */ 
  my_schar++;              /* not compliant - exceeded the maximum value. */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.6.3  
CERT-C : INT32-C  
CMSE : 6.1.14  
CWE : 128, 190, 192, 197, 680, 758  
GJB : 4.6.1.14  
HIS : 51  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-19-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 51  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.12.4  
SEC-C : R2.3.1  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
494 S
Numeric underflow.

Run-time operations on numeric variables that result in a value outside of the range of its type shall be avoided. Although wrap-around actions are sometimes intended, the practice is regarded as unsafe.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
static void static_494( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 494 S : Numeric underflow
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_494( void )
{
  /* char assumed to be signed */
  CHAR my_schar = -128;  /* 8-bit signed char types are in the range -128 to 127. */ 
  my_schar--;            /* Not ok - exceeded the minimum value. */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.6.3  
CERT-C : INT32-C  
CMSE : 6.1.14  
CWE : 128, 190, 191, 192, 197, 680, 758  
GJB : 4.6.1.14  
HIS : 51  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-19-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 51  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.12.4  
SEC-C : R2.3.1  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
495 S
Typedef name has no size indication.

The use of typedefs, as opposed to the basic numerical types, is encouraged to clarify the size of the storage. To ensure that this aim is fulfilled, each typedef of a numerical type must incorporate a value to indicate the size in bits.

A typedef that includes the phrase bool need not include a size. The phrase bool is not case sensitive.

This standard can be relaxed so that only ANSI built-in numerical types need to have a size indication by setting the modifier 392 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
typedef unsigned int uint32_t;    /* compliant */
typedef int Boolean;              /* compliant */
 
typedef unsigned short my_uint;   /* not compliant - should indicate size, e.g. uint16_t */ 
typedef uint32_t my_counter;      /* not compliant,  unless modifier 392 set             */
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 495 S : Typedef name has no size indication
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static void static_495( void )
{
   my_uint local_var;
   /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C : 4.1.1   Modifiers : 392 = 1
FSB582-C++ : 1.10   Modifiers : 392 = 1
MISRA-AC : 6.3   Modifiers : 392 = 1
MISRA-C:2004 : 6.3   Modifiers : 392 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : D.4.6   Modifiers : 392 = 1
NETRINO : 5.2.a   Modifiers : 392 = 1
SEC-C : P2.1.3   Modifiers : 392 = 1
496 S
Function call with no prior declaration.

The use of function prototypes enables the compiler to enforce the consistent use of a function interface, without the necessity to make assumptions about argument types for instance. If a function is to be invoked before it has been defined then the a prototype shall have previously been declared.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 496 S : Function call with no prior declaration.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_496( void )
{
 
  UINT_32 my_local = 42U;
 
  static_496_helper();    /* not compliant -  no prior declaration */ 
 
}
 
 
static void static_496_helper( SINT_16 p1 )  /* Not compatible with earlier implicit declaration */ 
{
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL31-C, EXP37-C  
CWE : 628  
MISRA-AC : 8.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 8.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.17.3  
NETRINO : 6.2.d  
SEC-C : M4.4.3, R2.8.3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , TBrun Requires
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c++.

497 S
Type is incomplete in translation unit.

A structure or union type shall not remain partially specified in a translation unit. Behaviour is undefined for any object that refers to an incomplete type.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 497 S : Type is incomplete in translation unit.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static void static_497( void )
{
  /* struct st is not specified */ 
 
  struct st s1;   /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
MISRA-AC : 18.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 18.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy
498 S
Use of inline keyword.

The inline keyword should not be used for member functions. Implicit inlining by means of putting the definition in the class body is preferred. This will instruct the compiler to inline rather than merely provide a hint to do so.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 498 S : Use of inline keyword
// A/Ref:
// 
 
class MyClass
{
  public:
    UINT_32 impl_in_method(void) { return 1U; }  // ok 
    UINT_32 expl_in_method1(UINT_32 m1p);
    inline UINT_32 expl_in_method2(UINT_32 m2p)
    {
      return m2p*2;
    }                                            // not ok 
};
 
void static_498( void );
 
 
inline UINT_32 MyClass::expl_in_method1(UINT_32 m1p)
{
  return m1p*2;
}                                                // not ok 
 
 
void static_498( void )
{
  MyClass * buffer = new MyClass;
 
  UINT_32 res1 = buffer->impl_in_method();
  UINT_32 res2 = buffer->expl_in_method1(res1);
  UINT_32 res3 = buffer->expl_in_method2(res2);
 
  // ... 
 
  delete buffer;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 5.2  
HIC++ : 3.1.7  
SEC-C : P1.1.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
499 S
Too many default parameters in copy ctor.

The use of default arguments to a copy constructor gives rise to ambiguity with compiler-supplied implicit copy constructors. Default parameters should be used with caution.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 499 S : Too many default parameters in copy ctor.
// A/Ref:
// 
 
class MyClass
{
  public:
    MyClass();
    // A default copy ctor will be created by compiler...
 
    MyClass(const MyClass & mc,
            UINT_32 m_b = 42U)          // not ok 
    { m_a = mc.m_a * 2; }
 
  protected:
  private:
    UINT_32 m_a;
    UINT_32 m_b;
};
 
void static_499( MyClass & mcp );
 
 
void static_499( MyClass & mcp )
{
  MyClass * buffer = new MyClass(mcp);  // which copy ctor is called? 
 
  // ... 
 
  delete buffer;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
JSF++ AV : 77.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

500 S
Class does not have a << output operator.

All classes should provide an output operator to facilitate debugging and testing of code.

Example
//LDRA_STANDARD_ON 500 S
#define __USE_STD_IOSTREAM
#include "c_standards.h"
#include <iostream> 
 
//
// Standard 500 S : Class does not have a << output operator.
// A/Ref:
// 
 
class MyClass
{
  public:
    MyClass() { m_data = "initial ";}
//
//  No overloaded 'operator <<' - not ok
//  ostream & operator <<(ostream & outp) { outp << m_data << "and more text "; return outp; }
// 
    char * m_data;
  protected:
  private:
};
 
void static_500( void );
 
 
void static_500( void )
{
  MyClass buffer;
 
  // ...
  // buffer << cout; 
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 3.1.12  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

501 S
Pure virtual member defined.

A pure virtual method signifies an abstract base class. The implementation of its pure virtual methods shall be provided by non-abstract classes, which derive from the base class, and not the base class itself.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 501 S : Pure virtual member defined.
// A/Ref:
// 
 
void static_501( void );
 
class Base
{
  public:
    virtual void pvf_member(void)=0;
  protected:
  private:
};
 
 
void Base::pvf_member(void) { ; }  // not ok 
 
 
class Derived : public Base
{
  public:
    void pvf_member(void) { ; }    // ok - overridden here in derived class 
};
 
 
void static_501( void )
{
  Derived * buffer = new Derived;
 
  // ... 
 
  delete buffer;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

502 S
Delete contains number of elements.

The number of elements shall not be specified when deleting an array of objects. The feature is obsolete and non-standard ISO C++.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 502 S : Delete contains number of elements.
// A/Ref:
// 
 
class MyClass
{
  public:
    MyClass();
  protected:
  private:
};
 
 
void static_502( void );
 
 
void static_502( void )
{
  MyClass * buffer = new MyClass[3];
  delete [2] buffer;     // not ok 
 
  UINT_32 * uint_array = new UINT_32[5];
  delete [3] uint_array; // not ok 
 
  SINT_32 * int_array = new SINT_32[7];
  delete [] int_array;  // ok 
 
  // ... 
 
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 12.4  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

503 S
Function returns local resources.

A dereferenced pointer (or reference) to a dynamically allocated local object shall not be returned by a function. Ownership of the resource is effectively transferred by the call, which may not be clear, resulting in 'dangling' handles.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 503 S : Function returns local resources.
// A/Ref:
// 
 
class MyClass
{
  public:
    MyClass();
  protected:
  private:
};
 
MyClass static_503( void );
 
 
MyClass static_503( void )
{
  MyClass * buffer = new MyClass;
 
  return * buffer;
}
 
 
int main(void)
{
  MyClass mc2;
 
  mc2 = static_503();  // not ok - resources have been created by call 
  // 
  return 0;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
CWE : 562, 825  
FSB582-C++ : 4.11  
HIC++ : 12.5  
JSF++ AV : 112  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
504 S
Space required between > and >.

Nested template arguments lead to successive > symbols, which could be interpreted as a shift operator if not delimited by a space character. Failure to insert a space between angle brackets may cause confusion.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 504 S : Space required between > and >.
// 
 
template <class A, class B> 
class Outer
{};
 
template <class C> 
class Inner
{};
 
void static_504( void );
 
 
void static_504( void )
{
  Outer <UINT_32,Inner <UINT_32>> notok;
  Outer <UINT_32, Inner <UINT_32> > ok;
  //... 
}
 
 
int main(void)
{
  static_504();
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 10.12  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

505 S
Control variable not declared in for loop.

In declaring the control variable in the for loop, scope of that variable is limited (and is specific) to that for loop.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
#define MAX_SIZE 10U
 
//
// Standard 505 S : Control variable not declared in for loop.
// 
 
void static_505( void );
 
 
void static_505( void )
{
  UINT_16 loop_var1;
 
  for (loop_var1 = 0U; loop_var1 < MAX_SIZE; loop_var1++) // Not ok 
  {
    ;
  }
 
  for (UINT_32 loop_var2 = 0U; loop_var2 < MAX_SIZE; loop_var2++)
  {
    ;
  }
}
 
 
int main(void)
{
  static_505();
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 5.12  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

506 S
Use of boolean with relational operator.

Do not use expressions with boolean type as operands to relational operators <, >, <=, and >=. The use of these operators is unlikely to lead to results that match the developer's expectations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/************************************************************
 * Standard 506 S : Use of boolean with relational operator.
 ************************************************************/
 
void static_506( const BOOL b1,
                 const BOOL b2 )
{
  if (b1 < b2)  /* not compliant  */
  {
     // ... 
  }
  else
  {
    // ... 
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 136  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 4-5-1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.10.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
507 S
Explicit cast from integral to floating type.

An explicit floating-point cast applied to a complex expression of integer type may lead to results that are a surprise to the developer. Such expressions are evaluated using integer arithmetic not floating-point. This standard applies to both static_cast and C-style type casts.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 507 S : Explicit cast from integral to floating type.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void static_507( SINT_32 i1, SINT_32 i2)
{
  FLOAT_32 ff;
 
  ff = static_cast < FLOAT_32 > ( i1 / i2 ); /* not compliant */
  ff = ( FLOAT_32 ) ( i1 / i2 );             /* not compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-7  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

508 S
Operator & overloaded.

By taking the address of an object of incomplete type, where the complete type contains an overloaded definition of the operator &, behaviour is undefined.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 508 S : Operator & overloaded.
// 
 
class MyClass;
 
void befoo( MyClass & mm );
void static_508( MyClass & mm );
 
 
void befoo( MyClass & mm )
{
  &mm; // built-in operator & 
}
 
 
class MyClass
{
  public:
    MyClass * operator & ();  // Not ok 
};
 
 
void static_508( MyClass & mm )
{
  &mm;  // overloaded operator & 
}
 
 
int main(void)
{
  MyClass my_c;
  //... 
  befoo( my_c );
  static_508( my_c );
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 8.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-3-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

509 S
goto label is backwards.

A backwards jump from a goto to a label can create iterations. The well defined iteration statements shall be used in preference. The use of goto statements is restricted to forward jumps to a label inside the same procedure.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
 
//
// Standard 509 S : goto label is backwards.
// 
 
void static_509( const UINT_32 p1 );
 
 
void static_509( const UINT_32 p1 )
{
  UINT_32 xx = 0;
  //... 
lab1:
  xx++;
  if ( p1 > xx )
  {
    goto lab2;  // Ok 
  }
  else
  {
    goto lab1;  // Not ok - results in an iteration 
  }
lab2:
  xx++;
  //... 
}
 
 
int main(void)
{
  //... 
  static_509( 42U );
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-6-2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.15.2  
SEC-C : M3.1.2  
510 S
Loop counter increment and operator defect.

Loop counters that are incremented such that values may be skipped should not be tested with == or !=. The loop may not terminate.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
#define MAX_SIZE 10U
 
/*************************************************************
 * Standard 510 S : Loop counter increment and operator defect.
 *************************************************************/
 
void static_510( void )
{
  for ( UINT_32 loop_var = 1U; 
        loop_var != MAX_SIZE;  /* not compliant */
        loop_var +=2U )
  {
    ;
  }
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 9.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-5-2  
SEC-C : R3.5.3  
Related standards filter models
RUNTIME
511 S
Jump into nested block.

The use of goto is restricted such that any label referenced by a goto should be in the same block or in an outer block that encloses the goto statement. Non compliance leads to complicated flow graphs and code that is difficult to maintain.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************
 * Standard 511 S : Jump into nested block.
 *****************************************/
 
#define MAX_SIZE 512
 
void static_511( UINT_32 p1 )
{
  UINT_32 local = 0U;
  UINT_32 action = 0U;
 
  goto lab1; /* not compliant */
 
  for(local; local < MAX_SIZE; local++)
  {
lab1:
    action += p1;
  }
 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-6-1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.15.3  
SEC-C : M3.1.2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
512 S
Use of unnamed namespace.

The use of unnamed namespaces in header files is not permitted. An unnamed namespace shall be unique within each translation unit. By declaring an entity in a header file within an unnamed namespace, that entity may span translation units but will not be common, which the developer may not expect.

Example

Static_512.h

#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*********************************************
 * Standard 512 S : Use of unnamed namespace.
 *********************************************/
 
namespace
{
  extern UINT_32 stat_dur;  /* not compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */

Static_512.cpp

#include "Static_512.h"
 
/*********************************************
 * Standard 512 S : Use of unnamed namespace.
 *********************************************/
 
namespace
{
  UINT_32 stat_dur;
}
 
void static_512( UINT_32 p1 )
{
  stat_dur = p1;  // Only visible within this translation unit...
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-3-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

513 S
Use of using directive.

Using-declarations or fully qualified names shall be adopted in favour of using-directives, as the latter adds additional scopes. Further lookups lead to the introduction of possibly unnecessary and potentially confusing extra identifiers.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
 
//
// Standard 513 S : Use of using directive.
// 
 
namespace NS1
{
  UINT_32 a1;
  UINT_32 b1;
  UINT_32 c1;
}
 
using namespace NS1;  // Not ok - using directive. 
 
namespace NS2
{
  UINT_32 a2;
  UINT_32 b2;
  UINT_32 c2;
}
 
using NS2::b2;        // Ok - using declarative. 
 
namespace NS3
{
  UINT_32 a3;
  UINT_32 b3;
  UINT_32 c3;
}
 
 
void static_513( void )
{
  ++a1;               // b1, c1 also visible but not required. 
  ++b2;
  ++NS3::c3;
}
 
 
int main( void )
{
  //... 
  static_513();
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 8.2.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-3-4  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

514 S
Using directive or declaration in header.

The placement of using-directives and using-declarations shall be avoided in header files, so that the behaviour of a program cannot be affected by the order in which header files are included.

Example

Static_514_1.h

/***********************************************************
 * Standard 514 S : Using directive or declaration in header.
 ************************************************************/
 
void func_514( UINT_32 );
 
namespace NS1
{
  void func_514( UCHAR );
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 *

Static_514_2.h

/***********************************************************
 * Standard 514 S : Using directive or declaration in header.
 ************************************************************/
 
namespace NS1
{
}
 
using namespace NS1;  /* not compliant - using directive. */
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */

Static_514.cpp

#include "c_standards.h"
 
#include "Static_514_2.h"
#include "Static_514_1.h"
 
/***********************************************************
 * Standard 514 S : Using directive or declaration in header.
 ************************************************************/
 
void static_514( void )
{
  func_514( 0U );  // Calls UCHAR version, but if the order of the
                   // header files switched then UINT_32 version called.
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 8.2.4  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-3-6  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

515 S
More than one variable in declaration.

Variable declarations shall not be combined with other declarators. Multiple declarators may lead to confusion regarding the type of an identifier.

Note that MISRA-C++:2008 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C++:2008 programming model or by setting the modifier 331 to 1 in the cppreport.dat file. (TBmisra license permitting). Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/************************************************************
 * Standard 515 S : More than one variable in declaration.
 ************************************************************/ 
 
UINT_16 * a1,          /* not compliant */
          b1 = 0;
 
void static_515( void )
{
  UINT_32 * local = NULL;
 
  local = (UINT_32 *)b1;  // Developer mistakenly believes b1 to be 
                          // a pointer type? 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 8-0-1   Modifiers : 331 = 1
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

516 S
Assembler does not use asm declaration.

Assembly code must be embedded using the standard asm keyword. Parameters to asm are still implementation-dependent, but it at least allows a consistent mechanism and aids portability.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 516 S : Assembler does not use asm declaration.
// 
 
void static_516_ok( void );
void static_516_notok( void );
 
 
void static_516_ok( void )
{
  asm("NOP");
}
 
 
void static_516_notok( void )
{
#pragma asm
  "NOP"
#pragma endasm
}
 
 
int main( void )
{
  //... 
  static_516_ok();
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-4-2  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

517 S
At least one declaration in global namespace.

The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations. The use of namespaces reduces the names found during lookup, reducing the chance of accidentally using an identifier in error.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/****************************************************************
 * Standard 517 S : At least one declaration in global namespace.
 *****************************************************************/
 
UINT_32 global;              /* not compliant */
 
 
namespace NS1
{
  UINT_32 stat_dur;
}
 
 
void static_517( void )
{
  ;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-3-1   Modifiers : 331 = 1
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

518 S
Using declaration is straddled by declarations.

A using-declaration shall not be straddled by multiple declarations for an identifier in the same namespace. Subsequent declarations after the using-declaration are not included when lookup occurs, which the developer may not expect.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
//
// Standard 518 S : Using declaration is straddled by declarations.
// 
 
void static_518( void );
 
namespace NS1
{
  void func_518( UINT_16 );
}
 
using NS1::func_518;
 
namespace NS1
{
  void func_518( UINT_32 );  // Not ok. 
}
 
 
void static_518( void )
{
  func_518( 0U );
}
 
 
int main( void )
{
  //... 
  static_518();
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
//
//
// Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
//
//
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-3-5  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

519 S
Return of reference parameter.

A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference. It is implementation-defined whether or not a temporary object is created for the parameter. However, if a local copy is used, returning a reference or a pointer leads to undefined behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/**************************************************
 * Standard 519 S : Return of reference parameter.
 **************************************************/
 
UINT_32 & static_519( UINT_32 & p1 )
{
  return ( p1 );  /* not compliant */
}
 
int main( void )
{
  UINT_32 xx;
  UINT_32 yy;
 
  yy = static_519(xx);
  //... 
  return 0;
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 4.11  
JSF++ AV : 112  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-5-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

520 S
Bit field is not bool or explicit integral.

Explicitly signed or unsigned integrals, or bool, shall be used for bit-fields. Using plain integer or an enumerated type is implementation-defined with regards to the underlying type representation as signed or unsigned.

This standard is only available when modifier 331 or 350 is set to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. (TBmisra license permitting). Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/****************************************************************
 * Standard 520 S : Bit field is not bool or explicit integral.
 *****************************************************************/
 
struct S
  {
    int xx : 2;  /* not compliant */
  };
 
 
void static_520( void )
{
  struct S st;
  //...
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2008 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 9-6-2, 9-6-3   Modifiers : 331 = 1
MISRA-C:2012 : R.6.1   Modifiers : 350 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
521 S
Class derived from virtual base class.

The use of classes that are derived from virtual base classes can lead to unexpected behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_521( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 521 S : Class derived from virtual base class.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class base521
{
   void proc();
  private:
   SINT_32 ff;
 
};
 
class deriv521: virtual base521 /* not compliant */ 
{
};
 
 
static void static_521( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 10-1-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

522 S
Public assign operator in abstract class.

The copy assignment operator shall not be declared public in an abstract class, as it results in only the base sub-objects being copied. This can lead to unexpected behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_522( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 522 S : Public assign operator in abstract class.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class c522
{
   public:
   c522 & operator = ( c522 & xx ); /* not compliant */ 
   virtual void proc() = 0;
};
 
static void static_522 ( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 3.3.14  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 12-8-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

523 S
Exception type is pointer.

If a pointer object to dynamically created memory is thrown, it may be unclear which function is then responsible for destroying it. To avoid this problem, exceptions should never be thrown as pointers.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_523( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 523 S : Exception type is pointer.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class c523
{
   SINT_32 ff;
};
 
static void static_523( void )
{
  /***/ 
  c523 ac523;
  c523 * ptr = & ac523;
  try {
     throw (ptr);    /* not compliant */ 
  }
  catch ( c523 * pp ) {
  }
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-0-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

524 S
Jump into try or catch statement.

A jump into a try or catch statement is illegal in C++. However, not all compilers will issue an error.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_524( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 524 S : Jump into try or catch statement.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
// note that this problem is usually caught by a compiler. 
 
static void static_524( void )
{
  /***/ 
  SINT_32 aa = 7;
  if ( aa == 0 )
  {
    goto l1;   /* not compliant */ 
  }
  try {
    SINT_32 ss = 0;
    l1: ss = 2;  /* not compliant */ 
  }
  catch(...){
  }
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-0-3   Modifiers : 331 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

525 S
throw with explicit NULL.

throw(NULL) is always caught by an integer handler. Developers might expect it to be caught by a pointer handler. An explicit cast on NULL to a pointer should be used.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_525( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 525 S : throw with explicit NULL.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_525( void )
{
  /***/ 
  try {
     throw( NULL ); /* not compliant */ 
  }
  catch(SINT_32 * pp) {
  }
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-1-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

526 S
Empty throw is not in catch statement.

An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in a catch statement, otherwise the behaviour of the program is dependent on the implementation.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_526( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 526 S : Empty throw is not in catch statement.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_526( void )
{
 
  throw;    /* not compliant */ 
 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-1-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

527 S
No master exception handler.

A master exception handler should exist that catches all unhandled exceptions. Otherwise, the behaviour of the program is dependent on the implementation.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_527( void );
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 527 S : No master exception handler.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
int main ( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;   /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 248  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-3-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

528 S
Base class constructor omitted (added by Testbed).

All constructors of a class should explicitly call a constructor for its immediate base classes and virtual base classes. This can lead to unexpected behaviour as it may not be obvious which constructors are used. Testbed adds the required base class constructors.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 528 S : Base class constructor omitted (added by Testbed).
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
  class base528 {
     public:
  };
 
  class no_base_ctor_528: base528 {
     public:
     no_base_ctor_528()    /* not compliant */ 
     {
     }
 
  } ;
 
static void static_528( void )
{
  no_base_ctor_528 a528;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 12-1-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

529 S
Static member initialised/assigned in constructor.

Static members shall not be changed in constructors. Otherwise the behaviour of the program is dependent on the implementation.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 529 S : Static member initialised/assigned in constructor.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class  cl529 {
   public:
   cl529()
   {
      ff529 = 7; /* not compliant */ 
   }
   private:
   static SINT_16 ff529;
};
 
static void static_529( void )
{
  cl529 a529;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 12-8-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

530 S
NULL used in integer context.

NULL has the value 0, which is both an integer and the value for a null pointer. It is recommended that NULL be used as the null pointer constant and 0 for the integer zero.

Example
#include <stdlib.h> 
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_530( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 530 S : NULL used in integer context.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_530( void )
{
  /***/ 
  UINT_32 xx = 0;
  if( xx == NULL ){;}   /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 4-10-1  
SEC-C : M4.6.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
531 S
Literal zero used in pointer context.

The literal value 0 is both an integer and the value for a null pointer. It is recommended that NULL be used as the null pointer constant and 0 for the integer zero.

Example
#include <stdlib.h> 
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 531 S : Literal zero used in pointer context.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_531( void )
{
  UINT_32 * pxx = NULL ;
  if( pxx == 0 ) {;} /* not compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 253, 398  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 4-10-2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.11.9  
SEC-C : M4.6.1, R2.7.3  
532 S
No copy ctor for templated copy ctor.

There should be an explicit copy constructor if a template copy constructor is present, otherwise a default constructor is generated by the compiler. The programmer may be surprised when the default constructor is called in preference to the one explicitly supplied.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_532( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 532 S : No copy ctor for templated copy ctor.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class A
{
public:
   A ( ) { }
   // A ( A const & rhs ); // #1 - implicitly generated copy constructor 
 
   template <typename T> 
   A ( T const & rhs )     // #2 
   : i ( new SINT_32 )
   {
     *i = *rhs.i;
   }
 
private:
   SINT_32 * i;            // Member requires deep copy 
};    /* not compliant */ 
 
 
 
static void static_532( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 4.2  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-5-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

533 S
No assgnmt optor for templated assgmnt op.

There shall be an explicit copy assignment operator if a template assignment operator is present. Otherwise, a default copy assignment operator is generated by the compiler. The programmer may be surprised when the default constructor is called in preference to the one explicitly supplied.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_533( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 533 S : No assgnmt optor for templated assgmnt op.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class A
{
public:
   // A & operator= ( A const & rhs )   #1 - implicitly generated 
   // { 
   //    i = rhs.i; 
   //    return *this; 
   //  } 
   template <typename T> 
   T & operator= ( T const & rhs )   // #2 
   {
      if ( this != & rhs ) {
         delete i;
         i = new SINT_32;
         *i = *rhs.i;
      }
   return *this;
   }
 
private:
   SINT_32 * i;
}; // not compliant 
 
static void static_533( void )
{
  ;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 4.2  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-5-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

534 S
Array has decayed to pointer.

Function parameters declared with a pointer type should not be indexed as if they were arrays. Arrays should be passed by reference.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/**************************************************
 * Standard 534 S : Array has decayed to pointer.
 **************************************************/
 
SINT_32 static_534( SINT_32 *ptr, SINT_32 ( &ref )[ 10 ]   )
{
  ptr[1] = 9;    /* not compliant */
  ref[1] = 9;    /* compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-2-12  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

535 S
Binary bitwise op with different types.

Both operands of binary bitwise operators should have the same (underlying) type. This prevents confusion over how many bits are used.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_535( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 535 S : Binary bitwise op with different types.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_535( void )
{
  UINT_32 i535 = 7U;
  UINT_16 j535 = 9U;
  i535 ^= j535;    /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-20  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

536 S
Enum type in bit field.

Enumerated types shall not be used as a bit-field type as the C++ standard does not specify whether the underlying representation is signed or unsigned.

Note that MISRA-C++:2008 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C++:2008 programming model or by setting the modifier 331 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. (TBmisra license permitting). Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 536 S : Enum type in bit field.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
typedef enum { aa, bb } enum_536;
 
static void static_536( void )
{
  struct tag
  {
    enum_536 a:4;    /* not compliant */
  };
 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 9-6-3   Modifiers : 331 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

537 S
Extra loop control variable changed.

A loop control variable is taken to be any variable that is initialised in the first expression of a for statement or altered in the third expression. Multiple loop control variables can make the code difficult to understand.

A loop control variable shall not be modified in the second expression of a for loop. Nor shall a loop control variable be modified in the third expression of a for loop, unless it is incremented or decremented. This reduces the risk of a non-terminating loop.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 537 S : Extra loop control variable changed.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static UINT_32 test ( UINT_32 *v )
   {
      *v = *v + 1U;
      return ( *v < 10U );
   }
 
 
static void static_537( void )
{
 UINT_32 bool_a = FALSE;
 UINT_32 x;
 for ( x = 0U;
       ( x < 10U ) && test ( & bool_a );   /* not compliant */ 
       ++x )
  {
    ;
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 9.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-5-5  
538 S
Template class/function/member not instantiated.

Class, function and member templates should always be instantiated. A missing instantiation may indicate a problem with the code.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_538( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 538 S : Template class/function/member not instantiated.
 *******************************************************************/ 
template <typename T> class cl538{
   void proc538 ()
   {
   }
};  /* not compliant */ 
 
static void static_538( void )
{
  /***/ 
    ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-7-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

539 S
Specialised overloaded templated function.

Overloaded function templates shall not be explicitly specialised. The specializations occur after overload resolution and may be contrary to the developer's expectations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 539 S : Specialised overloaded templated function.
 *******************************************************************/ 
template <typename T> 
     void proc(T p1){}      // function 1 
template <typename T> 
     void proc(T *p1){}     // function 2 
 
// This is a specialisation of function 1, for T == SINT_32* 
template <> 
     void proc <SINT_32> (SINT_32 p2){}  /* not compliant */ 
 
static void static_539( SINT_32 *value )
{
  proc(value);  // Calls function 2 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-8-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

540 S
Cast from pointer to void to pointer.

A cast from a pointer to void to a pointer shall not be performed. This may lead to unspecified behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_540( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 540 S : Cast from pointer to void to pointer.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_540( void )
{
  void * pv = 0;
  UINT_16 * pu;
  pu = reinterpret_cast <UINT_16 *> (pv);    /* not compliant */ 
 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP36-C  
CWE : 588, 737  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-2-8  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

541 S
Catch-all is not last catch.

An ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur after any other handlers. Otherwise, any handlers after the catch-all handler will never be executed.

Example
// Note this may not always compile. 
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_541( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 541 S : Catch-all is not last catch.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_541( void )
{
  try {
  }
  catch (...){  /* not compliant */ 
  }
  catch(SINT_32 pp){
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-3-7  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

542 S
Extra loop control variable is not bool.

A loop control variable is taken to be any variable that is initialised in the first expression of a for statement or altered in the third expression. Multiple loop control variables can make the code difficult to understand.

This standard permits more than one loop control variable if the extra variable has a boolean type, since such variables are typically used to terminate a loop early.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************
 * Standard 542 S : Extra loop control variable is not bool.
 *****************************************************/ 
 
static void static_542 ( void )
{
  INT_32 x = 0;
  INT_32 y = 0;
 
  for (x = 0;  (x < 10) && (y != 21); x++, y++)
                            /* not compliant */ 
  {
    ;
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 9.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-5-6  
543 S
Virtual base not in diamond hierarchy.

A virtual base shall only be used as the common base class in a diamond hierarchy. This avoids potentially confusing behaviours.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_543( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 543 S : Virtual base not in diamond hierarchy.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class base1 {
   virtual void proc();
};
 
class deriv1: virtual base1 {
};
 
static void static_543( void )
{
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 10-1-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

544 S
Member re-declared pure.

A virtual function that is not pure shall not be overridden by a pure virtual function. This may not meet developer's expectations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_544( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 544 S : Member re-declared pure.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class base1 {
   virtual void proc()=0;
};
class base2: base1 {
   virtual void proc()
   {}
};
class base3: base2 {
   virtual void proc()=0;  // not compliant 
};
 
static void static_544( void )
{
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 10-3-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

545 S
Assignment of overlapping storage.

Assignment between objects that have overlapping storage is undefined and shall not be used.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_545( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 545 S : Assignment of overlapping storage.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_545( void )
{
   union
   {
      UINT_16 i;
      UINT_32 j;
   } a;
 
   a.j = 23U;
   a.i = a.j;   /* not compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758, 843  
MISRA-AC : 18.2  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 0-2-1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 18.2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.19.1  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
546 S
Overload resolution could be forward.

The function or operator chosen by the overload resolution shall resolve to a function/operator declared before the template declaration. Otherwise, the behaviour may be contrary to the developer's expectations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 546 S : Overload resolution could be forward.
 *******************************************************************/ 
void func (SINT_32 pp){}
 
template <typename T > void proc(T aa )
{
     func(aa); // not compliant 
}
 
void func (UINT_32 pp){}
 
static void static_546( void )
{
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-6-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

547 S
Base member not qualified.

All names in the dependent base of a class template shall be qualified by using a qualified-id or this. Otherwise, the behaviour may be contrary to the developer's expectations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 547 S : Base member not qualified.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class base {
     protected:
       INT_32  abf;
     };
 
 
class deriv : public base {
      void aproc()
      {
         abf = 77;        /* not compliant */
         base::abf = 79;  /* compliant */
         this-> abf = 0;  /* compliant */
      }
   };
 
 
static void static_547( void )
{
  ;
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-6-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

548 S
Procedure body needs brackets.

The use of curly brackets, { }, around a procedure body is recommended for maintenance purposes.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_548( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 548 S : Procedure body needs brackets.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
SINT_32 glob=0;
 
void duff_proc() try{}catch(...){};     /* not compliant */ 
 
static void static_548( void )
{
   duff_proc();
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

549 S
Catch in c'tor/d'tor references nonstatic member.

Exception handlers in a constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members from the same class or its bases. This leads to undefined behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 549 S : Catch in c'tor/d'tor references nonstatic member.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class aclass {
  public:
   SINT_32  aff;
   aclass()
   {
      try{ }
      catch(...){ aff = 9; bff = 7; } /* not compliant */ 
   }
  private:
   SINT_32  bff;
};
 
static void static_549( void )
{
  ;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-3-3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

550 S
Unsuffixed hex or octal is unsigned, add U.

A U suffix shall be added to unsigned hexadecimal and octal literals. The type of hexadecimal and octal literals depends on the implemented integer size. The addition of the suffix clarifies the type to the reader.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 550 S : Unsuffixed hex or octal is unsigned, add U.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static void static_550( void )
{
  /***/ 
  UINT_32 xx;
  xx = 0x8ff7ffff  ;    /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 10.6  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 2-13-3  
MISRA-C:2004 : 10.6  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.7.2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
551 S
Cast from base to derived for polymorphic type.

Down-casting an abstract base class to a derived class should be avoided. Such casting may cause unexpected behaviour if the code is later modified.

Note that MISRA-C++:2008 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C++:2008 programming model or by setting the modifier 331 to 1 in the creport.dat file. (TBmisra license permitting). Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 551 S : Cast from base to derived for polymorphic type.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class base {
   public:
   virtual void proc()=0;
};
 
class deriv: public base {
   virtual void proc(){};
};
 
 
static void static_551( base & b1 )
{
  deriv d1;
  deriv * pd1;
  base * pb = & b1;
  pd1 = reinterpret_cast <deriv *> (& b1);    /* not compliant */ 
  pd1 = dynamic_cast <deriv *> (& b1);    /* not compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-2-3   Modifiers : 331 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

552 S
Class, enum, struct or union name reused.

Tag names shall not be re-declared within the program, other than through the inclusion of a header file containing the definition, in multiple source files.

Note that MISRA-C++:2008 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C++:2008 programming model or by setting the modifier 331 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. (TBmisra license permitting). Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 552 S : Class, enum, struct or union name reused.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void proc ()
{
  class bone {};
 
  {
    int bone;             /* not compliant */ 
  }
}
 
static void static_552( )
{
  int bone;             /* not compliant */ 
 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 2-10-4   Modifiers : 331 = 1
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

553 S
Function and proto should both be static.

If a function is declared static, all re-declarations or definitions should include the static specifier. This clarifies the linkage of the function to the developer.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_553( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 553 S : Function and proto should both be static.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
void static_553( void ) /* not compliant */ 
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL15-C  
CWE : 736  
MISRA-AC : 8.11  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 3-3-2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 8.11  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.8.8  
NETRINO : 1.8.a, 6.2.e  
SEC-C : M2.2.3  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
554 S
Cast to an unrelated type.

Casts between pointers to unrelated types leads to undefined behaviour. This standards checks for the following casts:

  • To or from pointer to structure (unless to the same structure)
  • To or from pointer to class (unless to the same class or to a pointer to a derived class)
  • From pointer to integer to pointer to float
  • From pointer to float to pointer to integer
Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************
 * Standard 554 S : Cast to an unrelated type.
 *******************************************************/ 
 
struct tag1
{
     UINT_16 u16;
};
 
struct tag2
{
   UINT_32 u32; 
};
 
static void static_554( void )
{
  struct tag1 *st1;
  struct tag2 *st2;
 
  st2 = (struct tag2 *)(st1); /* not compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP11-C, EXP36-C  
CWE : 737  
DERA : 45  
GJB : 4.12.1.1, 4.12.2.1  
HIC++ : 13.7  
HIS : 45  
JSF++ AV : 182  
MISRA-AC : 11.4  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 3-9-3, 5-2-7  
MISRA-C:1998 : 45  
MISRA-C:2004 : 11.4  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.11.2, R.11.3  
SEC-C : R2.7.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
555 S
Base class member name not unique.

All visible base class members should be unique names. This removes the possibility of ambiguous names, which the compiler may fail to report.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_555( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 555 S : Base class member name not unique.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class base {
    SINT_32 aff;
};
 
class deriv : public base {
   SINT_32  aff;      /* not compliant */ 
};
 
static void static_555( void )
{
  ;
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 10-2-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

556 S
Wrong order of catches for derived class.

A base class handler shall occur after any derived class handlers. Otherwise, any handlers after the base class handler will never be executed.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 556 S : Wrong order of catches for derived class.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class base
{
};
 
class deriv : public base {
};
 
static void static_556( void )
{
  try {
  }
  catch( base & p1) {  /* not compliant */ 
 
  }
  catch( deriv & p2 ){
  }
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-3-6  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

557 S
Function call can generate throw exception.

A function call should not throw an exception.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_557( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 557 S : Function call can generate throw exception.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void throwfunc()
{
    throw;
}
 
 
static void static_557( void )
{
 
  throwfunc();    /* not compliant */ 
 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 15-1-1, 15-3-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

558 S
Template may lead to ill-formed program.

A template should not contain features that may lead to an ill-formed program.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_558( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 558 S : Template may lead to ill-formed program.
 *******************************************************************/ 
template <typename T> class duff {
    void func()
    {
       T at;
       at.xx = 77; /* not compliant */ 
    }
};
 
static void static_558( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 14-7-2  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

559 S
Virtual member defined more than once.

There shall be only one definition of each virtual member function on each path through the hieracrchy. This provides clarity of the code.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_559( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 559 S : Virtual member defined more than once.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class one {
   virtual void func(){}
};
 
class two : public one {
   virtual void func();
};
 
class three : public two {
   virtual void func(){}  /* not compliant */ 
};
 
 
static void static_559( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 10-3-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

560 S
Scope of variable could be reduced.

It is good practise to restrict the scope of a variable to the scope in which it is used. This reduces the possibility that the identifier is used accidentally.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 560 S : Scope of variable could be reduced.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static void static_560( void )
{
  UINT_16 us;
  {
     us = 78;    /* not compliant */ 
  }
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
JPL : 6  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 0-1-6, 3-4-1  
561 S
Use of dynamic type in c'tor/d'tor.

The dynamic type of an object shall not be used in its constructor or destructor. During the construction and destruction of an object, its type may be different to that of the completely constructed object. Therefore, the result may be contrary to the developer's expectations.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_561( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 561 S : Use of dynamic type in c'tor/d'tor.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class one {
    virtual void func();
    one()
    {
          typeid(one);   /* not compliant */ 
    }
};
 
 
static void static_561( void )
{
 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 12-1-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

562 S
Use of ++,-- or = in macro parameters.

Increment, decrement and assignment operators should not be used as macro parameters. Such use can lead to unspecified behaviour if the expanded expression depends on the order in which side effects take place.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_562( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 562 S : Use of ++,-- or = in macro parameters.
 *******************************************************************/ 
#define MAC( x )  x + 10
 
static void static_562( void )
{
  INT_16 aa = 1;
  /***/ 
  MAC ( aa++ );    /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : PRE31-C  
CWE : 735  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
563 S
Address increment exceeds type limit.

... Awaiting Documentation ...

564 S
Reference assignment to wider scope.

The scope of the reference is wider than the scope of the reference being assigned which can lead to undefined behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static SINT_32 & static_564( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 564 S : Reference assignment to wider scope.
 *******************************************************************/ 
SINT_32 aglob = 9;
 
static SINT_32 &  static_564( void )
{
  SINT_32 aloc = aglob;
  return aloc;       /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CWE : 562, 825  
FSB582-C++ : 4.11  
HIC++ : 11.7  
JSF++ AV : 111, 173  
LMTCP : 206, 316  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-5-1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

565 S
Assignment to wider scope.

The scope of the variable is wider than the scope of the address being assigned which can lead to undefined behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 565 S : Assignment to wider scope.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
struct tag
{
   UCHAR ff;
};
 
struct tag  *uglob;
 
static void static_565( void )
{
    static struct tag avar;
    uglob = & avar;          /* not compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL30-C  
CWE : 758  
FSB582-C++ : 4.11  
MISRA-AC : 17.6  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 7-5-2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 17.6  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.18.6  
SEC-C : X3.x  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
567 S
Pointer arithmetic is not on array.

Performing arithmetic on pointers that are not arrays is considered to be an unsafe activity since there is no guarantee that the result is a valid address.

This standard can be relaxed to allow subtraction between pointers by setting the modifier 436 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_567( UINT_32 * pp );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 567 S : Pointer arithmetic is not on array.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_567( UINT_32 * pp )
{
  UINT_32 * xx;
  xx = pp +7;    /* not compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR37-C   Modifiers : 436 = 1
CWE : 188, 468, 469  
MISRA-AC : 17.1, 17.4  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-15   Modifiers : 436 = 1
MISRA-C:2004 : 17.1, 17.4  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.18.1, R.18.4   Modifiers : 436 = 1
568 S
#include "filename" uses standard library name.

The filename used in a #include should not be the same as a library name. The file that is included depends on the implementation.

Note that this standard is only enabled by setting the modifier 344 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 568 S : #include "filename" uses standard library name.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void static_568( void )
{
  /***/ 
      /* not compliant when modifier 344 is set */ 
#include "stdlib.h" 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : PRE04-C   Modifiers : 344 = 1
CWE : 735   Modifiers : 344 = 1
FSB582-C++ : 3.9   Modifiers : 344 = 1
HIC++ : 14.9  
SEC-C : P1.4.2   Modifiers : 344 = 1
Related standards filter models
Legacy
569 S
Operator should be non class member.

Operators should not be class members. It is not possible to perform an implicit conversion on the left hand side of a binary operator when the operator is a class member.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_569( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 569 S : Operator should be non class member.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class one {
   one(){}
   SINT_32 operator - ( const SINT_32 xx ){return 77;}  /* not compliant */ 
};
 
 
static void static_569( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 3.5.4  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

570 S
Static object declared in namespace.

The static keyword should not be used when declaring objects in namespaces, as it is deprecated by the C++ standard.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_570( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 570 S : Static object declared in namespace.
 *******************************************************************/ 
namespace namsp570 {
    static SINT_32 xx;     /* not compliant */ 
}
 
static void static_570( void )
{
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 8.3.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

571 S
Identifier with 'l' and 1, 'O' and zero.

An identifier should not include both 'l'(ell) and 1(one) or 'O'(oh) and '0'(zero). The characters are similar and may confuse the reader.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 571 S : Identifier with 'l' and 1, 'o' and zero.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static void static_571( void )
{
  SINT_32  Oday0 = 0;     /* not compliant */ 
  SINT_32  dlay1 = 0;     /* not compliant */ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 8.4.1  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

572 S
Side effect in assert.

There should be no side effects in assert expressions. This enables assertions to be disabled or removed in production code.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_572( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 572 S : Side effect in assert.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_572( void )
{
  /***/ 
  UCHAR xx = 99;
  assert( xx = 91);   /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 10.8  
JPL : 5  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
573 S
Macro concatenation of uni char names.

A universal character name shall not be created by macro concatenation. This can lead to undefined behaviour.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_573( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 573 S : Macro concatenation of uni char names.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
 
static void static_573( void )
{
  /***/ 
  ;    /* not compliant */ 
#define makename(uc1, uc2, uc3, uc4) uc1##uc2##uc3##uc4
 
makename ( \U00010401, \U00010401, \U00010401, \U00010402 ) = 4;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : PRE30-C  
CWE : 735, 758  
MISRA-AC : 1.2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 1.2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy
574 S
Operator new called with inconsistent type.

The new operator shall not allocate space for an inconsistent type. This is illegal in C++, but not all compilers will produce an error.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
/* Note that this example may fail to compile */ 
 
static void static_574( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 574 S : Operator new called with inconsistent type.
 *******************************************************************/ 
class one {
};
 
class two {
};
 
 
static void static_574( void )
{
  /***/ 
  two * ptwo = new one();    /* not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards filter models
Legacy
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

575 S
Linkage differs from previous declaration.

Multiple declarations of an identifier shall not have both internal and external linkage, as this leads to undefined behaviour.

Other aspects concerning linkage are covered by standards 461 S and 2 X.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void static_575( void );
 
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 575 S : Linkage differs from previous declaration.
 *******************************************************************/ 
static INT_32 DCL36_i2 = 20;
INT_32 DCL36_i2;   /* not compliant */ 
 
static void static_575( void )
{
  /***/ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL36-C  
CWE : 758  
MISRA-AC : 1.2  
MISRA-C:2004 : 1.2  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.8.8  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy
576 S
Function pointer is of wrong type.
