MISRA-C:2004 : 5.7  
SEC-C : X3.x  
59 X
Identifier reuse: enum constant vs enum constant.

Identifier names should not be reused across any files in the system, regardless of scope. This violation captures a specific instance of identifier reuse not explicitly checked under the rules applied by 4 X to 48 X.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 59 X : Identifier reuse: enum constant vs enum constant
 * A/Ref:
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void);
 
void bar(void);
 
 
void foo(void)
{
  enum e_tag1
  {
    first,   /* Not compliant */ 
    runnerup
  } e_obj1;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
void bar(void)
{
  enum e_tag2
  {
    first,   /* Not compliant */ 
    second
  } e_obj2;
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 5.7  
MISRA-C:2004 : 5.7  
60 X
Identifier reuse: variable vs variable.

Identifier names should not be reused across any files in the system, regardless of scope. This violation captures a specific instance of identifier reuse not explicitly checked under the rules applied by 4 X to 48 X.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 60 X : Identifier reuse: variable vs variable
 * A/Ref:
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void foo(void);
 
void bar(void);
 
 
void foo(void)
{
  UINT_32 local_var = 0;   /* Not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
void bar(void)
{
  UINT_32 local_var = 0;   /* Not compliant */ 
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-AC : 5.7  
MISRA-C:2004 : 5.7  
61 X
Identifier match in *** chars.

Identifiers shall not rely on the significance of more than a limited number of characters, which is typically 31. Compiler support varies, and if the limit is exceeded the behaviour is undefined.

The limit is user definable. The *** symbols refer to a user definable number for this standard, defaulting to 31. The configuration is made in the c/cpppen.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 61 X : Identifier match in *** chars
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
UINT_32 global_variable_with_long_name1x;   /* not compliant */ 
UINT_32 global_variable_with_long_name1y;   /* not compliant */ 
 
void XREF_061(void)
{
  /***/ 
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL32-C  
CWE : 758  
DERA : 11  
FSB582-C : 3.5.5  
HIS : 11  
JSF++ AV : 46  
LMTCP : 69  
MISRA-AC : 1.4, 5.1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 11  
MISRA-C:2004 : 1.4, 5.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.5.1, R.5.2, R.5.3, R.5.4  
62 X
Function prototype/defn return type mismatch (MR).

The return type given for a function declaration and definition shall be identical. The base type, qualifiers, and typedef name must all match.

This standard is restricted to LDRA Testbed installations featuring the MISRA component, as indicated by (MR).

Note that for C++ files, MISRA-C++:2008 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C++:2008 programming model or by setting the modifier 331 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef unsigned int ANOTHER_UINT_32;
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 62 X : Function prototype/defn return type mismatch.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
ANOTHER_UINT_32 xref_62(void);
 
 
UINT_32 xref_62(void)         /* Not compliant */ 
{
  UINT_32 ret_val = 0;
  /***/ 
  return ret_val;
}
 
 
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
MISRA-AC : 8.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 3-2-1, 3-9-1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 8.3  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.8.4  
NETRINO : 4.3.c  
SEC-C : R2.8.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
63 X
Function prototype/defn param type mismatch (MR).

The formal parameter types given for a function declaration and definition shall be identical. The base type, qualifiers, and typedef name must all match.

This standard is restricted to LDRA Testbed installations featuring the MISRA component, as indicated by (MR).

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
typedef unsigned int ANOTHER_UINT_32;
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 63 X : Function prototype/defn param type mismatch.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
UINT_32 xref_63(ANOTHER_UINT_32 p1);
 
 
UINT_32 xref_63(UINT_32 p1)         /* Not compliant */ 
{
  UINT_32 ret_val = p1;
  /***/ 
  return ret_val;
}
 
 
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2007 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
FSB582-C : 3.7.4  
MISRA-AC : 8.3  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 3-9-1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 8.3  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.8.3, R.8.4  
NETRINO : 4.3.c  
SEC-C : M4.5.1, R2.8.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
64 X
Array bound exceeded at call.

An array parameter has been indexed by a value that is not in the range specified for the array.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 64 X : Array bound exceeded at call.
 *******************************************************************/
 
static INT_32 indexArray ( const INT_32 array [] )
{
  return array[4];
}
 
INT_32 XREF_064 ( void )
{
   INT_32 array[3] = {1, 2, 3};
   return indexArray( array ); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR30-C  
CWE : 121, 122, 124, 126, 127, 129, 193, 466, 758, 823  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.17.5, R.18.1  
SEC-C : X3.x  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
65 X
continue in ill-formed loop.

Some guidelines do not permit the use of continue in complex loops.

Note that MISRA-C++:2008 checking needs to be enabled in order for this violation to be detected, either via selection of the MISRA-C++:2008 programming model or by setting the modifier 331 to 1 in the c/cppreport.dat file. (TBmisra license permitting). Instructions for making alterations can be found in the report.dat file.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 65 X : Continue in ill-formed loop.
 *******************************************************************/
 
static void XREF_065 ( void )
{
   INT_32 j = -1;
   INT_32 i;
 
   for ( i = 0; i != 10 && j != i; ++i )
   {
      if ( ( i % 2 ) == 0 )
      {
         continue;     /* not compliant - loop is not well-formed */
      }
      ++j;
   }
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C++:2008 : 6-6-3   Modifiers : 331 = 1
66 X
Insufficient array space at call.

When copying from source to destination, the destination must not overrun as a result of the operation. Overrun leads to data corruption. This standard reports problems where the source is a parameter to a procedure. Other situations are covered by standards 489 S, 70 X and 71 X.

Example
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 66 X : Insufficient array space at call.
 *******************************************************************/
 
void copy (char src_array[])
{
   char dest_arr[3];
   (void) strcpy (dest_arr, src_array); /* not compliant */
}
 
void XREF_066 ( void )
{
   char arrc[10];
   copy(arrc);
}
 
int main ( void )
{
   XREF_066 ( );
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR33-C, STR31-C  
CWE : 121, 122, 758  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
67 X
Identifier is typographically ambiguous.

It is not advisable to use identifiers that appear the same in some typefaces, as this can lead to the developer confusing one identifier with another.

Example
#include "c_standards.h" 
 
static void xref_67( void );
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 67 X : Identifier is typographically ambiguous.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
static void xref_67 ( void )
{
   INT_32 id1_a_bc;
   INT_32 id1_ab_c;     /* not compliant */ 
   INT_32 id2_ii;
   INT_32 id2_11;       /* not compliant */ 
   INT_32 id3_i0;
   INT_32 id3_1O;       /* not compliant */ 
   INT_32 id4_in;
   INT_32 id4_1h;       /* not compliant */ 
   INT_32 id5_Z5;
   INT_32 id5_2S;       /* not compliant */ 
   INT_32 id6_ZS;
   INT_32 id6_25;       /* not compliant */ 
   /***/ 
   ;
   /***/ 
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : DCL02-C  
CWE : 736  
JSF++ AV : 48  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 2-10-1  
MISRA-C:2012 : D.4.5  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
68 X
Parameter indexing array too big at call.

A procedure parameter has been used to index an array and exceeds the range specified for the array.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 68 X : Parameter indexing array too big at call.
 *******************************************************************/
 
static INT_32 index_too_large ( UINT_32 index )
{
   INT_32 array[10] = {0};
   return array[index];
}
 
INT_32 XREF_068( void )
{
  return index_too_large( 20U ); /* not compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR30-C  
CWE : 121, 122, 124, 126, 127, 129, 193, 466, 758, 823  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.18.1  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
69 X
Global array bound exceeded at use.

An index has been found which is not in the range specified for a globally declared array. This standard is enforced for arrays that are explicitly declared or whose size can be determined from their initialisation. The use of local arrays or indexing via procedure calls are reported using 47 S, 64 X, 68 X and 72 X.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 69 X : Global array bound exceeded at use.
 *******************************************************************/
 
INT_32 array[3] = {1, 2, 3};
 
INT_32 XREF_069 ( void )
{
   return array[3]; /* not compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR30-C  
CWE : 121, 122, 124, 126, 127, 129, 193, 466, 758, 823  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.18.1  
SEC-C : X3.x  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
70 X
Array has insufficient space.

When copying from source to destination, the destination must not overrun as a result of the operation. Overrun leads to data corruption. This standard reports problems where the destination is a parameter to a procedure. Other situations are covered by standards 489 S, 66 X and 71 X.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
#include <stdlib.h>
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 70 X : Array has insufficient space.
 *******************************************************************/
 
void copy (char *dest_array)
{
   char src_array[8] = "abcdefg";
   (void) strcpy (dest_array, src_array); 
}
 
void XREF_070 ( void )
{
   char arr_3[3];
   copy(arr_3);  /* not compliant */
}
 
int main ( void )
{
   XREF_070 ( );
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR33-C, STR31-C  
CWE : 121, 122, 758  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
71 X
Insufficient space for copy.

When copying from source to destination, the destination must not overrun as a result of the operation. Overrun leads to data corruption. This standard reports problems where both the source and destination are parameters to a procedure. Other situations are covered by standards 489 S, 66 X and 70 X.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
#include <string.h>
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 71 X : Insufficient space for copy. 
 *******************************************************************/
 
void copy (char *dest_array, char *src_array)
{
   (void) strcpy (dest_array, src_array); /* not compliant */
}
 
void XREF_070 ( void )
{
   char arr_3[3];
   char src_array[8] = "abcdefg";
   copy(arr_3, src_array);  
}
 
int main ( void )
{
   XREF_071 ( );
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : ARR33-C, STR31-C  
CWE : 121, 122, 758  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.1.3  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
72 X
Parameter indexing array too small at call.

A procedure parameter has been used to index an array, and is found to have a value less than 0.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
static INT_32 XREF_072 (  INT_32 index )
{
   INT_32 array[10] = {0};
   return array[index];
}
 
#define OFFSET 12
 
INT_32 main ( void )
{
  return XREF_072(10-OFFSET); /* not compliant */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2010 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC15-C  
CWE : 758  
MISRA-AC : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2004 : 21.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.18.1  
SEC-C : X3.x  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME
73 X
Bits discarded in >> on parameter in function.

Shifts can cause bits with the value 1 to be discarded. This may not be the user's intention. This standard checks that a shift using function arguments does not cause such bits to be shifted outside the original size of the left hand operand.

The limits for the standard types need to be specified in the c/cppvals.dat and c/cpptbend.dat files. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************************
 * Standard 73 X : Bits discarded in >> on parameter in function.
 *****************************************************************/
 
void proc(UCHAR p1)
{
   UCHAR res;
   res = p1 >> 1;  /* 00000111 >> 1 gives 0000011 which discards "1" */
}
 
void XREF_O73( void )
{
   proc(7U); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2013 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
74 X
Bits discarded in << by parameter in function.

Shifts can cause bits with the value 1 to be discarded. This may not be the user's intention. This standard checks that a shift using function arguments does not cause such bits to be shifted outside the original size of the left hand operand.

The limits for the standard types need to be specified in the c/cppvals.dat and c/cpptbend.dat files. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************************
 * Standard 74 X : Bits discarded in << by parameter in function.
 *****************************************************************/
 
void proc(UCHAR p1)
{
   UCHAR res;
   res = 15U << p1;  /* 00001111 << 7 gives 10000000 which discards 3 "1" */
}
 
void XREF_O74( void )
{
   proc(7U); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2013 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
75 X
Bits discarded in >> by parameter in function.

Shifts can cause bits with the value 1 to be discarded. This may not be the user's intention. This standard checks that a shift using function arguments does not cause such bits to be shifted outside the original size of the left hand operand.

The limits for the standard types need to be specified in the c/cppvals.dat and c/cpptbend.dat files. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************************
 * Standard 75 X : Bits discarded in >> by parameter in function.
 *****************************************************************/
 
void proc(UCHAR p1)
{
   UCHAR res;
   res = 3U >> p1;  /* 00000011 >> 7 gives 00000000 which discards 2 "1" */
}
 
void XREF_O75( void )
{
   proc(7U); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2013 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
76 X
Bits discarded in << on parameter in function.

Shifts can cause bits with the value 1 to be discarded. This may not be the user's intention. This standard checks that a shift using function arguments does not cause such bits to be shifted outside the original size of the left hand operand.

The limits for the standard types need to be specified in the c/cppvals.dat and c/cpptbend.dat files. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************************
 * Standard 76 X : Bits discarded in << on parameter in function.
 *****************************************************************/
 
void proc(UCHAR p1)
{
   UCHAR res;
   res = p1 << 6;  /* 00001111 << 6 gives 11000000 which discards 2 "1" */
}
 
void XREF_O76( void )
{
   proc(15U); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2013 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
77 X
Bits discarded in >> between parameters in function.

Shifts can cause bits with the value 1 to be discarded. This may not be the user's intention. This standard checks that a shift using function arguments does not cause such bits to be shifted outside the original size of the left hand operand.

The limits for the standard types need to be specified in the c/cppvals.dat and c/cpptbend.dat files. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*********************************************************************
 * Standard 77 X : Bits discarded in >> between parameters in function.
 *********************************************************************/
 
void proc(UCHAR p1, UCHAR p2)
{
   UCHAR res;
   res = p1 >> p2;  /* 00000011 >> 7 gives 00000000 which discards 2 "1" */
}
 
void XREF_O77( void )
{
   proc(3U, 7U); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2013 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
78 X
Bits discarded in << between parameters in function.

Shifts can cause bits with the value 1 to be discarded. This may not be the user's intention. This standard checks that a shift using function arguments does not cause such bits to be shifted outside the original size of the left hand operand.

The limits for the standard types need to be specified in the c/cppvals.dat and c/cpptbend.dat files. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*********************************************************************
 * Standard 78 X : Bits discarded in << between parameters in function.
 *********************************************************************/
 
void proc(UCHAR p1, UCHAR p2)
{
   UCHAR res;
   res = p1 >> p2;  /* 00000011 << 7 gives 10000000 which discards "1" */
}
 
void XREF_O78( void )
{
   proc(3U, 7U); /* not compliant */
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2013 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
1 I
Local variables contribute nothing to results.

Information flow analysis cannot find any output statement which is affected by this variable.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************
 * Information Flow 1 I : Local variables contribute nothing to results.
 ********************************************************/ 
 
UINT_32 InfoFlow001( void )
{
   UINT_32 result = 0;
   UINT_32 if_1 = 0;   /* if_1 does not contribute to the result */
 
   return (result);
} /* not compliant */
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2001 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards filter models
Legacy
1 Q
Call has execution order dependant side effects.

A function call, placed on the right hand side of the logical operator && or ||, or ternary operator, shall not contain parameter side effects. By nature of the expression, the function may not be called depending on the values of the other sub-expressions. This conditional evaluation may not be obvious to all and can lead to mistakes.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************
 * Standard 1 Q : Call has execution order dependant side effects
 ********************************************************/
 
BOOL Test_q1( UINT_32 Position, UINT_32 *Won )
{
  UINT_32 NewWins = *Won;
  BOOL bWon = FALSE;
 
  if ( Position == 1U )
  {
    bWon = TRUE;
    NewWins++;
  }
  *Won = NewWins;
  return ( bWon );
}
 
 
BOOL QUALREP_001(UINT_32 *Places, UINT_32 races)
{
  BOOL bWonAll = TRUE;
  UINT_32 WonCount = 0U;
  UINT_32 Race = 0U;
  UINT_32 RacePosition;
 
  while (Race <races)
  {
    RacePosition = Places[Race];
    bWonAll = ( bWonAll && ( Test_q1( RacePosition, &WonCount ) ) ); /* not compliant */
    Race++;
  }
 
  return ( WonCount > 0U );
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2001 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : EXP02-C, EXP10-C, EXP30-C, FIO41-C  
CWE : 737, 758, 768  
DERA : 33, 46  
FSB582-C : 3.10.1, 3.10.2  
FSB582-C++ : 9.17, 9.21  
HIC++ : 10.3, 10.9  
HIS : 33, 46  
JSF++ AV : 157, 204  
LMTCP : 286, 362  
MISRA-AC : 12.2, 12.4  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 5-0-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 33, 46  
MISRA-C:2004 : 12.2, 12.4  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.13.1, R.13.2, R.13.5  
SEC-C : M1.8.1, R3.6.1, R3.6.2  
Related standards filter models
CONFORM , Legacy , RUNTIME , UML , VSOS
2 Q
LCSAJ density exceeds ***.

The *** symbols refer to a user definable number, defaulting to 20 for this standard. The configuration is made in the c/cppreport.dat or c/cpppen.dat file. Instructions for making alterations can be found in the manual.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
/* not compliant message appears at start of file */
 
/********************************************
 * Standard 2 Q : LCSAJ density exceeds ***.
 ********************************************/
 
BOOL isHexDigit( CHAR TestChar )
{
  BOOL bResult;
 
  bResult = FALSE;
 
  if ((TestChar == '0') ||
      (TestChar == '1') ||
      (TestChar == '2') ||
      (TestChar == '3') ||
      (TestChar == '4') ||
      (TestChar == '5') ||
      (TestChar == '6') ||
      (TestChar == '7') ||
      (TestChar == '8') ||
      (TestChar == '9') ||
      (TestChar == 'A') ||
      (TestChar == 'a') ||
      (TestChar == 'B') ||
      (TestChar == 'b') ||
      (TestChar == 'C') ||
      (TestChar == 'c') ||
      (TestChar == 'D') ||
      (TestChar == 'd') ||
      (TestChar == 'E') ||
      (TestChar == 'e') ||
      (TestChar == 'F') ||
      (TestChar == 'f'))
  {
    bResult = TRUE;
  }
 
  return bResult;
}
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2001 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
DERA : 145  
3 Q
Filename contains upper case letters.

Filenames shall only contain lower case letters. Always using lower case avoids the possibility of conflicts on systems that are not case sensitive.

Related standards model rules
HIC++ : 14.12  
LMTCP : 81  
NETRINO : 4.1.a  
Related standards filter models
VSOS
4 Q
Included file has path.

Include statements must not contain directory (path) information. Portability of the code may be affected by hard-coding paths to files.

Example
/* not compliant */
#include "C:\Testbed\Examples\Standards\C\Violations\Quality_report\c_standards.h"
/* not compliant */
#include <sys/limits.h>
 
/********************************************************
 * Quality Report 4 Q : Included file has path.
 ********************************************************/
 
void QUALREP_001(void)
{
  /* ... */
}

 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates

GJB : 4.1.1.20  
HIC++ : 14.10  
NETRINO : 4.3.d  
SEC-C : P1.5.1  
5 Q
File does not end with new line.

C files are required to end in a new-line character, otherwise the behaviour is undefined.

Example
Related standards model rules

1 U

Related standards model rules

2 U
Procedure not called anywhere in system.
Related standards model rules
CAST : 5.16.18  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 0-1-10  
Related standards filter models
Legacy
3 U
No procedures in this file called from other files.
Related standards filter models
Legacy
1 J
Unreachable Code found.

Code is unreachable if there is no syntactic path to it. Even if such code was intentional, a compiler may choose not to include that code in the final executable.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 1 J : Unreachable Code found.
 *******************************************************************/
 
UINT_32 j_001 (BOOL param)
{
  UINT_32 local_var;
 
  if (param == TRUE )
  {
    local_var = param; 
  }
  else
  {
    local_var = 0U;
  }
 
  return local_var;
 
  return 0;  /* not compliant - cannot possibly reach this line */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
CERT-C : MSC07-C  
CWE : 561, 570, 571  
DERA : 52  
HIS : 52  
JSF++ AV : 186  
LMTCP : 337  
MISRA-AC : 14.1  
MISRA-C++:2008 : 0-1-1, 6-6-1  
MISRA-C:1998 : 52  
MISRA-C:2004 : 14.1  
MISRA-C:2012 : R.2.1  
SEC-C : M1.9.1  
Related standards filter models
Legacy , RUNTIME , UML
2 J
Unused inspect annotation.

The LDRA_INSPECT annotation can be placed before code which normally causes a standards violation message to be issued, causing the message to be suppressed. This prevents the re-issuing of messages for code which has been checked and found to be acceptable, but still enable LDRA Testbed to flag any other occurrences of that standards violation.

This standard checks that the relevant message has been suppressed.

Further checks on the INSPECTED annotation are performed by 305 S and 47 D.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************************
 * Standard 2 J : Unused inspect annotation.
 *******************************************************************/
 
UINT_32 j_002 (BOOL param)
{
  UINT_32 local_var;
 
  if (param == TRUE )
  {
    local_var = param; 
  }
  else
  {
    local_var = 0U;
  }
  return local_var;
 
  /*LDRA_INSPECTED 3 J*/      /* not compliant - 3 J not produced */
  return 0;  /* produces 1 J */
}
 
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2006 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards filter models
Legacy
3 J
All internal linkage calls unreachable.
Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*******************************************************
 * Standard 3 J : All internal linkage calls unreachable.
 *******************************************************/
 
static INT_32 proc( void )  /* not compliant */
{
  return 1;
}
 
void j_003 ( void )
{
  return;
  (void)proc(); /* unreachable line - procedure proc is not called */
}
 
/*
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2009 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
MISRA-C:2012 : R.2.1  
1 Z
File exceeds required size.

Z Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Userstandards.c file in Userstandards/User_standards_z folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

1 H
Global Variable does not conform to style g_<name>.

Global variables shall prefixed with g_.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 1 H : Global Variable does not conform to style g_<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
INT_32 myglobal;  /* not compliant */
 
INT_32 g_var1;    /* compliant */
 
void hungarian_1 ( void )
{
  ;
}
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C : 3.2.1  
FSB582-C++ : 12.2  
NETRINO : 7.1.j  
2 H
Class Member does not conform to style m_<name>.

Class members shall be prefixed with m_.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 2 H : Class Member does not conform to style m_<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class Ch2
{ 
   public:
    INT_32 avariable;   /* not compliant */
    INT_32 m_variable;  /* compliant */
};
 
 
void hungarian_2 (void)
{
  Ch2 x;
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 12.2  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

3 H
Enum Element does not conform to style e_<name>.

Enumeration constants shall be prefixed with e_.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 3 H : Enum Element does not conform to style e_<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
enum EColour  {e_Red,
               blue,  /* not compliant */
               e_white
             };
 
 
void hungarian_3 ( void )
{
  enum EColour flag;
}
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
4 H
Class Name does not conform to style C<name>.

Class names shall be prefixed with C.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 4 H : Class Name does not conform to style C<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
class one  /* not compliant */
{ 
   public:
     INT_32 data;
};
 
 
void hungarian_4 (void)
{
  one x;
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 12.2  
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

5 H
Namespace Name does not conform to style N<name>.

Namespace names shall be prefixed with N.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 5 H : Namespace Name does not conform to style N<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
namespace MySpace1  /* not compliant */
{
  class CString
  {
    // ... 
  };
}
 
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Language restrictions

This standard is not applicable to c.

6 H
Pointer does not conform to style p_<name>.

Variables with a pointer type shall be prefixed with p_.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
#include "c_standards.h"
 
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 6 H : Pointer does not conform to style p_<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
void hungarian_6 ( INT_32 *p_x,    /* compliant */
                   INT_32 *my_ptr  /* not compliant */
                 )
{
  ;
}
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
NETRINO : 7.1.k  
7 H
Enum Name does not conform to style E<name>.

Enumeration tags shall be prefixed with E.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example
/********************************************************************
 * Standard 7 H : Enum Name does not conform to style E<name>.
 *******************************************************************/ 
 
enum Colour  /* not compliant */
             {e_red,
              e_blue,  
              e_white
             };
 
enum Etraffic{ e_green, e_yellow, e_red };
 
void hungarian_7 ( void )
{
  enum Colour flag;
  enum Etraffic light;
}
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C++ : 12.2  
8 H
Global Func Name does not conform to style <file>_<name>.

Global functions shall be prefixed with the source file name.

H Standards are only enabled if the appropriate INI flag is set as described in Hstandards.cpp file in Userstandards/Hungarian_notation_h folder of the Testbed installation directory. This file also enables the user to modify the check to conform to their company standard.

Example

Hungarian_008.c

#include "c_standards.h"
 
/*****************************************************************************
 * Standard 8 H : Global Func Name does not conform to style <file>_<name>.
 *****************************************************************************/ 
 
void Hungarian_nok ( void ) /* not compliant */
{
  ;
}
 
void Hungarian_008_ok ( void )
{
  ;
}
 
/*
 * Copyright (c) 2012 Liverpool Data Research Associates
 *
 */
Related standards model rules
FSB582-C : 3.2.1  
NETRINO : 6.1.i
